entries.name: Physical Damage
entries.description_html:
Physical damage is one of the five Damage Types. It is the most common and the only one reduced by Armour, rather than by a Resistance.

Most physical damage comes from Weapon Attacks, but some Spells and other skills deal physical damage as well. Physical damage over time can be inflicted with Bleeding.
entries.description_plain: Physical damage is one of the five Damage Types. It is the most common and the only one reduced by Armour, rather than by a Resistance. Most physical damage comes from Weapon Attacks, but some Spells and other skills deal physical damage as well. Physical damage over time can be inflicted with Bleeding.

entries.name: Fire Damage
entries.description_html: Fire damage is one of the five Damage Types. It is reduced by Fire Resistance. Fire Hits inflict Flammability based on how much Fire damage is dealt, which provides a chance to Ignite.
entries.description_plain: Fire damage is one of the five Damage Types. It is reduced by Fire Resistance. Fire Hits inflict Flammability based on how much Fire damage is dealt, which provides a chance to Ignite.

entries.name: Cold Damage
entries.description_html: Cold damage is one of the five Damage Types. It is reduced by Cold Resistance. Cold hits apply Chill and build up Freeze, but cannot build up Heavy Stun.
entries.description_plain: Cold damage is one of the five Damage Types. It is reduced by Cold Resistance. Cold hits apply Chill and build up Freeze, but cannot build up Heavy Stun.

entries.name: Lightning Damage
entries.description_html: Lightning damage is one of the five Damage Types. It is reduced by Lightning Resistance. Lightning hits have a chance to Shock based on how much Lightning damage is dealt.
entries.description_plain: Lightning damage is one of the five Damage Types. It is reduced by Lightning Resistance. Lightning hits have a chance to Shock based on how much Lightning damage is dealt.

entries.name: Chaos Damage
entries.description_html:
Chaos damage is one of the five Damage Types. It is reduced by Chaos Resistance.
Chaos damage is the least common damage type, and removes twice as much Energy Shield as the damage value when taken.
entries.description_plain: Chaos damage is one of the five Damage Types. It is reduced by Chaos Resistance. Chaos damage is the least common damage type, and removes twice as much Energy Shield as the damage value when taken.

entries.name: Ailments
entries.description_html: Ailments are a family of common Debuffs associated with specific damage types. The list of Ailments is: Bleeding, Ignite, Chill, Freeze, Shock, Electrocute, and Poison.
entries.description_plain: Ailments are a family of common Debuffs associated with specific damage types. The list of Ailments is: Bleeding, Ignite, Chill, Freeze, Shock, Electrocute, and Poison.

entries.name: Attributes
entries.description_html:
Strength, Dexterity, and Intelligence are the 3 primary attributes. The most important use of Attributes is to meet requirements to use Equipment and Gems.

Each Attribute provides a different inherent bonus.
entries.description_plain: Strength, Dexterity, and Intelligence are the 3 primary attributes. The most important use of Attributes is to meet requirements to use Equipment and Gems. Each Attribute provides a different inherent bonus.

entries.name: Strength
entries.description_html:
Strength is an Attribute required to equip most equipment that grants Armour, as well as various melee-aligned Weapons and Skills.

Strength provides an inherent bonus of +2 to maximum Life per 1 Strength.

Strength does not grant damage to Skills or any other benefits except where specifically stated.
entries.description_plain: Strength is an Attribute required to equip most equipment that grants Armour, as well as various melee-aligned Weapons and Skills. Strength provides an inherent bonus of +2 to maximum Life per 1 Strength. Strength does not grant damage to Skills or any other benefits except where specifically stated.

entries.name: Dexterity
entries.description_html:
Dexterity is an Attribute required to use most equipment that grants Evasion Rating, as well as various range-aligned Weapons and Skills.

Dexterity provides an inherent bonus of +8 to Accuracy Rating per 1 Dexterity.

Dexterity does not grant damage to Skills or any other benefits except where specifically stated.
entries.description_plain: Dexterity is an Attribute required to use most equipment that grants Evasion Rating, as well as various range-aligned Weapons and Skills. Dexterity provides an inherent bonus of +8 to Accuracy Rating per 1 Dexterity. Dexterity does not grant damage to Skills or any other benefits except where specifically stated.

entries.name: Intelligence
entries.description_html:
Intelligence is an Attribute required to use most equipment that grants Energy Shield, as well as various spell-aligned Weapons and Skills.

Intelligence provides an inherent bonus of +2 to maximum Mana per 1 Intelligence

Intelligence does not grant damage to Skills or any other benefits except where specifically stated.
entries.description_plain: Intelligence is an Attribute required to use most equipment that grants Energy Shield, as well as various spell-aligned Weapons and Skills. Intelligence provides an inherent bonus of +2 to maximum Mana per 1 Intelligence Intelligence does not grant damage to Skills or any other benefits except where specifically stated.

entries.name: Bleeding
entries.description_html:
Bleeding is an Ailment that deals Physical damage over time, and lasts 5 seconds by default. Damage from Bleeding bypasses Energy Shield

Bleeding deals an extra 100% damage while the target is moving, or if the Bleeding is Aggravated.

Physical damage from Hits Contributes to Bleeding Magnitude.

Damage does not Contribute to Bleeding chance, so it cannot be inflicted without an explicit source of Bleeding chance.

The base Magnitude of Bleeding is Physical damage per second equal to 15% of the Pre-mitigation Physical damage of the Hit that inflicted it. This magnitude is not further affected by any modifiers to the damage you deal.

Modifiers and Debuffs that affect the enemy's ability to mitigate damage (such as Shock) can affect the damage the enemy takes from Bleeding, but any such modifiers that specifically apply to Hit damage (such as Armour Break) do not affect Bleeding damage.

entries.name: Blind
entries.description_html: Being Blinded causes 20% less Accuracy Rating and Evasion Rating, and lasts for 4 seconds unless otherwise specified.
entries.description_plain: Being Blinded causes 20% less Accuracy Rating and Evasion Rating, and lasts for 4 seconds unless otherwise specified.

entries.name: Chill
entries.description_html:
Chill is an Ailment that Slows the afflicted target, and lasts 2 seconds on players or 8 seconds on non-players by default. Chill Magnitude depends on the Chilling damage dealt relative to the target's Elemental Ailment Threshold, with a minimum of 30% and a default maximum of 50%.

Cold damage from Hits can Chill by default, and does not require a chance to inflict Chill. However, Chills smaller than 30% will be ignored, so small Hits can fail to Chill.

Chill Magnitude depends on the Chilling damage dealt relative to the target's Elemental Ailment Threshold, with a minimum of 30% and a default maximum of 50%. Cold damage from Hits can Chill by default, and does not require a chance to inflict Chill. However, Chills smaller than 30% will be ignored, so small Hits can fail to Chill.

entries.name: Chilled Ground
entries.description_html: Chilled Ground Chills those standing in it, and lasts 6 seconds by default.
entries.description_plain: Chilled Ground Chills those standing in it, and lasts 6 seconds by default.

entries.name: Consecrated Ground
entries.description_html: You and Allies standing on your Consecrated Ground Regenerate 5% of their maximum Life per second, and Curses have 50% reduced effect on them.
entries.description_plain: You and Allies standing on your Consecrated Ground Regenerate 5% of their maximum Life per second, and Curses have 50% reduced effect on them.

entries.name: Culling Strike
entries.description_html: Culling Strikes kill Normal enemies if their life is at 30% or below. Magic enemies are instead killed at 20%, Rare at 10% and Unique at 5%. These thresholds are checked before the damage of the Hit is applied.
entries.description_plain: Culling Strikes kill Normal enemies if their life is at 30% or below. Magic enemies are instead killed at 20%, Rare at 10% and Unique at 5%. These thresholds are checked before the damage of the Hit is applied.

entries.name: Decimating Strike
entries.description_html: Hits against Full Life Enemies remove between 5% and 30% of Life, before the damage of the Hit is applied.
entries.description_plain: Hits against Full Life Enemies remove between 5% and 30% of Life, before the damage of the Hit is applied.

entries.name: Damage Types
entries.description_html: The damage types are Physical, Fire, Cold, Lightning and Chaos.
entries.description_plain: The damage types are Physical, Fire, Cold, Lightning and Chaos.

entries.name: Damaging Ailments
entries.description_html: Ailments that deal damage are Bleeding, Ignite, and Poison.
entries.description_plain: Ailments that deal damage are Bleeding, Ignite, and Poison.

entries.name: Defences
entries.description_html: Armour, Evasion Rating and Energy Shield are the standard Defences. Other protective stats such as Resistances are not counted as Defences.
entries.description_plain: Armour, Evasion Rating and Energy Shield are the standard Defences. Other protective stats such as Resistances are not counted as Defences.

entries.name: Desecrated Ground
entries.description_html: You take Chaos damage over time while standing in Desecrated Ground.
entries.description_plain: You take Chaos damage over time while standing in Desecrated Ground.

entries.name: Elemental Ailments
entries.description_html: Elemental Ailments are Ignite, Chill, Freeze, Shock, and Electrocute.
entries.description_plain: Elemental Ailments are Ignite, Chill, Freeze, Shock, and Electrocute.

entries.name: Freeze
entries.description_html:
Freeze is an Ailment that causes targets to be unable to move or act, and lasts 4 seconds by default.

Cold damage from Hits Contributes to Freeze Buildup on enemies until they become Frozen.
entries.description_plain: Freeze is an Ailment that causes targets to be unable to move or act, and lasts 4 seconds by default. Cold damage from Hits Contributes to Freeze Buildup on enemies until they become Frozen.

entries.name: Hinder
entries.description_html: Hinder is a Debuff that Slows movement speed by 30% unless otherwise specified. Unless Specified, Hinder has a duration of 4 seconds.
entries.description_plain: Hinder is a Debuff that Slows movement speed by 30% unless otherwise specified. Unless Specified, Hinder has a duration of 4 seconds.

entries.name: Ignite
entries.description_html:
Ignite is an Ailment that deals Fire damage over time, and lasts for 4 seconds by default.

The chance for a Hit to Ignite a target is determined by the total Magnitude of Flammability on the target, including the amount added by that Hit.

Fire damage from Hits Contributes to the Magnitude of Ignite, so Hits dealing more Fire damage inflict stronger Ignites.
The base Magnitude of Ignite is Fire damage per second equal to 20% of the Fire damage dealt by the Hit that inflicted it. This is calculated using the final damage dealt by the Hit, but not any modifiers on the target that affect how much damage they will take from the Hit. This Magnitude is not further affected by any modifiers to the damage you deal.

Modifiers and Debuffs that affect the enemy's ability to mitigate damage (such as Shock) can affect the damage the enemy takes from Ignite, but any such modifiers that specifically apply to Hit damage (such as Penetration) do not affect Ignite damage.

The chance for a Hit to Ignite a target is determined by the total Magnitude of Flammability on the target, including the amount added by that Hit. Fire damage from Hits Contributes to the Magnitude of Ignite, so Hits dealing more Fire damage inflict stronger Ignites. entries.name: Flammability
entries.description_html:
Flammability is a Debuff that provides the chance for Hits to Ignite the target. It is not itself an Ailment, but is closely associated with Ignite, which is.

Fire damage from Hits Contributes to the Magnitude of Flammability, so Hits that deal more Fire damage will Ignite more often.
The base Magnitude of Flammability is 1% chance to Ignite the target for every 5% of the target's Ailment Threshold dealt as Fire damage. Flammability from a Hit is applied before that hit checks whether it should Ignite the target, and so will affect that chance for that Hit to Ignite.

Since chance for Hits to Ignite comes from Flammability on the target, modifiers which increase the chance to inflict Ailments will increase the Magnitude of Flammability inflicted.

Effects which do not Hit targets, but Ignite as if they had, such as Ignited Ground, also inflict Flammability, but do not roll a random chance to Ignite. Such effects will onlyIgnite once the total Flammability on the target reaches 50%.

Multiple instances of Flammability stack, raising the chance for Hits to Ignite the target up to 100%. Each instance of Flammability has its own independent duration, lasting 8 seconds by default.

entries.name: Ignoring Resistances
entries.description_html: Ignoring Resistances means your damage cannot be modified in any way by the target's Resistance stats.
entries.description_plain: Ignoring Resistances means your damage cannot be modified in any way by the target's Resistance stats.

entries.name: Knockback
entries.description_html: Knockback pushes Enemies away when Hit.
entries.description_plain: Knockback pushes Enemies away when Hit.

entries.name: Life Leech
entries.description_html:
When you deal damage from a Hit, Leech causes you to recover an amount of the stated resource equal to a percentage of the damage you dealt.
Monsters have Leech Resistance that increases with monster level, reducing how much you recover from Leech.
Leeched Life is recovered over one second. Multiple Leeches can occur simultaneously.
entries.description_plain: When you deal damage from a Hit, Leech causes you to recover an amount of the stated resource equal to a percentage of the damage you dealt. Monsters have Leech Resistance that increases with monster level, reducing how much you recover from Leech. Leeched Life is recovered over one second. Multiple Leeches can occur simultaneously.

entries.name: Low Energy Shield
entries.description_html: You are on Low Energy Shield if you have 35% of your Maximum Energy Shield or less.
entries.description_plain: You are on Low Energy Shield if you have 35% of your Maximum Energy Shield or less.

entries.name: Low Life
entries.description_html: A player or monster is on Low Life if it has 35% of its Maximum Life or less.
entries.description_plain: A player or monster is on Low Life if it has 35% of its Maximum Life or less.

entries.name: Low Mana
entries.description_html: You are on Low Mana if you have 35% of your Maximum Mana or less.
entries.description_plain: You are on Low Mana if you have 35% of your Maximum Mana or less.

entries.name: Lucky
entries.description_html: Lucky things are rolled twice and the better result used.
entries.description_plain: Lucky things are rolled twice and the better result used.

entries.name: Maim
entries.description_html: Maimed enemies suffer from 30% Slower Movement Speed and 15% reduced Evasion Rating. Maim lasts for 4 seconds unless otherwise specified.
entries.description_plain: Maimed enemies suffer from 30% Slower Movement Speed and 15% reduced Evasion Rating. Maim lasts for 4 seconds unless otherwise specified.

Leeched Mana is recovered over one second. Multiple Leeches can occur simultaneously.

Leeched Rage is recovered over one second. Multiple Leeches can occur simultaneously.

entries.name: Map Owner
entries.description_html: The Map Owner is the player who created the Map area.
entries.description_plain: The Map Owner is the player who created the Map area.

entries.name: Non-Damaging Ailments
entries.description_html: Ailments that do not deal damage are Chill, Freeze, Shock, and Electrocute.
entries.description_plain: Ailments that do not deal damage are Chill, Freeze, Shock, and Electrocute.

entries.name: Overkill
entries.description_html: Overkill damage is any damage from a Hit in excess of the enemy's remaining Life when it is killed.
entries.description_plain: Overkill damage is any damage from a Hit in excess of the enemy's remaining Life when it is killed.

entries.name: Poison
entries.description_html:
Poison is an Ailment that deals Chaos damage over time, and lasts 2 seconds by default. Damage from Poison bypasses Energy Shield.

Physical and Chaos damage from Hits Contribute to Poison Magnitude.

Damage does not Contribute to Poison chance, so it cannot be inflicted without an explicit source of Poison chance.

The base Magnitude of Poison is Chaos damage per second equal to 20% of the Pre-mitigation Physical and Chaos damage of the Hit that inflicted it. This magnitude is not further affected by any modifiers to the damage you deal.

Modifiers and Debuffs that affect the enemy's ability to mitigate damage (such as Shock) can affect the damage the enemy takes from Poison, but any such modifiers that specifically apply to Hit damage (such as Penetration) do not affect Poison damage.
entries.description_plain: Poison is an Ailment that deals Chaos damage over time, and lasts 2 seconds by default. Damage from Poison bypasses Energy Shield. Physical and Chaos damage from Hits Contribute to Poison Magnitude. Damage does not Contribute to Poison chance, so it cannot be inflicted without an explicit source of Poison chance. The base Magnitude of Poison is Chaos damage per second equal to 20% of the Pre-mitigation Physical and Chaos damage of the Hit that inflicted it. This magnitude is not further affected by any modifiers to the damage you deal. Modifiers and Debuffs that affect the enemy's ability to mitigate damage (such as Shock) can affect the damage the enemy takes from Poison, but any such modifiers that specifically apply to Hit damage (such as Penetration) do not affect Poison damage.

entries.name: Rage
entries.description_html:
Rage grants 1% more Attack damage per 1 Rage gained, to a maximum of 30. You lose 1 Rage every 0.1 seconds if you have not taken damage or gained Rage in the last 2 seconds.

Only one Hit every 0.5 seconds can cause you to gain Rage.
entries.description_plain: Rage grants 1% more Attack damage per 1 Rage gained, to a maximum of 30. You lose 1 Rage every 0.1 seconds if you have not taken damage or gained Rage in the last 2 seconds. Only one Hit every 0.5 seconds can cause you to gain Rage.

entries.name: Recently
entries.description_html: Recently refers to the past 4 seconds.
entries.description_plain: Recently refers to the past 4 seconds.

entries.name: Shapeshifting
entries.description_html:
Shapeshifting changes you into a non-human form. Shapeshifting skills still use your character's stats as normal unless otherwise specified.

Using a skill that is not compatible with your shapeshifted form will automatically revert you to human form.
entries.description_plain: Shapeshifting changes you into a non-human form. Shapeshifting skills still use your character's stats as normal unless otherwise specified. Using a skill that is not compatible with your shapeshifted form will automatically revert you to human form.

entries.name: Shock
entries.description_html:
Shock is an Ailment that causes targets to take 20% increased damage, and lasts 4 seconds on players or 8 seconds on non-players by default.

Lightning damage from Hits Contributes to chance to Shock enemies. The higher the Lightning damage dealt, the higher the chance. By default a Hit has 1% chance to Shock for every 4% of the target's Ailment Threshold dealt.
entries.description_plain: Shock is an Ailment that causes targets to take 20% increased damage, and lasts 4 seconds on players or 8 seconds on non-players by default. Lightning damage from Hits Contributes to chance to Shock enemies. The higher the Lightning damage dealt, the higher the chance. By default a Hit has 1% chance to Shock for every 4% of the target's Ailment Threshold dealt.

entries.name: Smoke Clouds
entries.description_html:
Enemies standing in Smoke Clouds are Blinded.
Smoke Clouds have a radius of 2 metres unless otherwise specified.
entries.description_plain: Enemies standing in Smoke Clouds are Blinded. Smoke Clouds have a radius of 2 metres unless otherwise specified.

entries.name: Player Stun Threshold
entries.description_html: Your base Stun Threshold is equal to your maximum Life. A Hit that deals damage equal to or greater than your Stun Threshold is guaranteed to Stun you, and the chance scales down linearly for lower damage Hits. A Stun chance of less than 10% is treated as 0%.
entries.description_plain: Your base Stun Threshold is equal to your maximum Life. A Hit that deals damage equal to or greater than your Stun Threshold is guaranteed to Stun you, and the chance scales down linearly for lower damage Hits. A Stun chance of less than 10% is treated as 0%.

entries.name: Enemy Stun Threshold
entries.description_html: The lower an enemy's Stun Threshold, the less Stun buildup is needed to Stun or Heavy Stun them.
entries.description_plain: The lower an enemy's Stun Threshold, the less Stun buildup is needed to Stun or Heavy Stun them.

entries.name: Freeze Threshold
entries.description_html: Freeze Threshold determines how much Freeze buildup is needed to Freeze a target.
entries.description_plain: Freeze Threshold determines how much Freeze buildup is needed to Freeze a target.

entries.name: Unaffected
entries.description_html: Debuffs you are Unaffected by can still be placed on you, but will not actually apply their effect.
entries.description_plain: Debuffs you are Unaffected by can still be placed on you, but will not actually apply their effect.

entries.name: Uncapped Resistance
entries.description_html: Uncapped Resistance is the value a Resistance would have if ignoring Maximum Resistance. These values are shown in parentheses at the top of the Character Panel.
entries.description_plain: Uncapped Resistance is the value a Resistance would have if ignoring Maximum Resistance. These values are shown in parentheses at the top of the Character Panel.

entries.name: Overcapped Resistance
entries.description_html: Overcapped Resistance is the amount of a Resistance you have in excess of your Maximum Resistance for that damage type.
entries.description_plain: Overcapped Resistance is the amount of a Resistance you have in excess of your Maximum Resistance for that damage type.

entries.name: Unlucky
entries.description_html: Unlucky things are rolled twice and the worse result used.
entries.description_plain: Unlucky things are rolled twice and the worse result used.

entries.name: Immobilised
entries.description_html: A target is immobilised if it cannot move, for example due to being Frozen, Pinned, Heavy Stunned, or Electrocuted.
entries.description_plain: A target is immobilised if it cannot move, for example due to being Frozen, Pinned, Heavy Stunned, or Electrocuted.

entries.name: Stun
entries.description_html:
Hits against any target can potentially cause a Stun on that target, depending on the damage dealt. Stunning a target interrupts their current action and prevents them from taking actions for a short time. There are two types of Stun:

Light Stuns last a fraction of a second but can be inflicted frequently. Any Hit has a chance to cause a Light Stun. The chance is based on the damage dealt, up to 100% base chance for Hits that deal 100% of the target's maximum Life. Chances lower than 15% are treated as 0%.

Heavy Stuns occur when a target's Stun bar is filled and last multiple seconds. Hits cause Heavy Stun buildup based on the damage dealt. Players and their Minions usually cannot be Heavily Stunned, but players can receive Heavy Stun buildup where specifically mentioned while taking specific actions (such as raising their Shield, Parrying with a Buckler, or riding a mount).

Player Physical damage and Melee Damage each have 50% more Light Stun chance and Heavy Stun buildup. These bonuses are multiplicative with each other.
Monster Physical damage and Melee Damage have 100% more and 33% more Light Stun chance and Heavy Stun buildup respectively. These bonuses are multiplicative with each other.

The chance is based on the damage dealt, up to 100% base chance for Hits that deal 100% of the target's maximum Life. Chances lower than 15% are treated as 0%. Heavy Stuns occur when a target's Stun bar is filled and last multiple seconds. Hits cause Heavy Stun buildup based on the damage dealt. Players and their Minions usually cannot be Heavily Stunned, but players can receive Heavy Stun buildup where specifically mentioned while taking specific actions (such as raising their Shield, Parrying with a Buckler, or riding a mount). Player Physical damage and Melee Damage each have 50% more Light Stun chance and Heavy Stun buildup. These bonuses are multiplicative with each other. Monster Physical damage and Melee Damage have 100% more and 33% more Light Stun chance and Heavy Stun buildup respectively. These bonuses are multiplicative with each other.

entries.name: Light Stun
entries.description_html:
Any Hit has a chance to Light Stun the target, interrupting their current action and preventing them from taking actions for a fraction of a second. The chance is based on the damage dealt, up to 100% base chance for Hits that deal 100% of the target's maximum Life. Chances lower than 15% are treated as 0%.

Physical damage, and player (but not monster) Melee Damage, each have 50% more Light Stun chance. For players, these bonuses are multiplicative with each other.
entries.description_plain: Any Hit has a chance to Light Stun the target, interrupting their current action and preventing them from taking actions for a fraction of a second. The chance is based on the damage dealt, up to 100% base chance for Hits that deal 100% of the target's maximum Life. Chances lower than 15% are treated as 0%. Physical damage, and player (but not monster) Melee Damage, each have 50% more Light Stun chance. For players, these bonuses are multiplicative with each other.

entries.name: Heavy Stun
entries.description_html:
Heavy Stuns occur when a target's Stun bar is filled, interrupts the target's current action and prevent them from taking actions for a few seconds. Hits cause Heavy Stun buildup based on the damage dealt. Players and their Minions usually cannot be Heavily Stunned, but players can receive Heavy Stun buildup where specifically mentioned while taking specific actions (such as raising their Shield, Parrying with a Buckler, or riding a mount).

While an enemy is Heavy Stunned, they cannot act and count as Immobilised. It will also be harder to Heavy Stun them again for a short time afterwards.

Physical damage, and player (but not monster) Melee Damage, each cause 50% more Heavy Stun buildup. For players, these bonuses are multiplicative with each other.
entries.description_plain: Heavy Stuns occur when a target's Stun bar is filled, interrupts the target's current action and prevent them from taking actions for a few seconds. Hits cause Heavy Stun buildup based on the damage dealt. Players and their Minions usually cannot be Heavily Stunned, but players can receive Heavy Stun buildup where specifically mentioned while taking specific actions (such as raising their Shield, Parrying with a Buckler, or riding a mount). While an enemy is Heavy Stunned, they cannot act and count as Immobilised. It will also be harder to Heavy Stun them again for a short time afterwards. Physical damage, and player (but not monster) Melee Damage, each cause 50% more Heavy Stun buildup. For players, these bonuses are multiplicative with each other.

entries.name: Player Heavy Stun
entries.description_html: Players and their Minions usually cannot be Heavily Stunned, but players can receive Heavy Stun buildup where specifically mentioned while taking specific actions (such as raising their Shield, Parrying with a Buckler, or riding a mount). A player's stun bar only empties when they are not taking these actions or Heavily Stunned. While Heavily Stunned players cannot Block, Deflect or Evade.
entries.description_plain: Players and their Minions usually cannot be Heavily Stunned, but players can receive Heavy Stun buildup where specifically mentioned while taking specific actions (such as raising their Shield, Parrying with a Buckler, or riding a mount). A player's stun bar only empties when they are not taking these actions or Heavily Stunned. While Heavily Stunned players cannot Block, Deflect or Evade.

entries.name: Electrocution
entries.description_html:
Electrocution is an Ailment that interrupts the target's actions and prevents them performing any action, and lasts 5 seconds by default.

Only Lightning damage from Hits with specific skills or effects Contributes to Electrocution Buildup on enemies until they become Electrocuted. Other sources of Lightning damage will not build up towards Electrocution.
entries.description_plain: Electrocution is an Ailment that interrupts the target's actions and prevents them performing any action, and lasts 5 seconds by default. Only Lightning damage from Hits with specific skills or effects Contributes to Electrocution Buildup on enemies until they become Electrocuted. Other sources of Lightning damage will not build up towards Electrocution.

entries.name: Pinned
entries.description_html:
Certain skills and effects allow damage to build up Pinned. Once this build up passes the enemy's Pinned Threshold, they are Pinned, preventing them moving, being moved or Evading for 3 seconds. They are also Light Stunned when they become Pinned.

Pinned targets count as Immobilised.
entries.description_plain: Certain skills and effects allow damage to build up Pinned. Once this build up passes the enemy's Pinned Threshold, they are Pinned, preventing them moving, being moved or Evading for 3 seconds. They are also Light Stunned when they become Pinned. Pinned targets count as Immobilised.

entries.name: Overwhelm
entries.description_html: Overwhelm negates a certain amount of the target's Physical damage reduction, but never more than the total Physical damage reduction the target has.
entries.description_plain: Overwhelm negates a certain amount of the target's Physical damage reduction, but never more than the total Physical damage reduction the target has.

entries.name: Melee
entries.description_html:
Melee Attacks are those that directly hit with a melee Strike or a Slam, dealing Melee damage. Melee attacks usually scale from Weapon or Unarmed damage.

Any Projectiles these attacks create do not count as Melee damage.
entries.description_plain: Melee Attacks are those that directly hit with a melee Strike or a Slam, dealing Melee damage. Melee attacks usually scale from Weapon or Unarmed damage. Any Projectiles these attacks create do not count as Melee damage.

entries.name: Slams
entries.description_html: Slams are Melee Attacks that cause damaging areas of effect, rather than Striking enemies with your weapon directly. Damage from Slams is still Melee damage.
entries.description_plain: Slams are Melee Attacks that cause damaging areas of effect, rather than Striking enemies with your weapon directly. Damage from Slams is still Melee damage.

entries.name: Chain
entries.description_html:
Effects that Chain are redirected to another target after hitting an enemy. Projectiles cannot Chain from enemies they Pierce or Fork from.
Projectiles have a base chaining distance of 6 metres whereas other effects have a chaining distance of 4 metres. Enemies cannot be Hit more than once in the same Chain.
entries.description_plain: Effects that Chain are redirected to another target after hitting an enemy. Projectiles cannot Chain from enemies they Pierce or Fork from. Projectiles have a base chaining distance of 6 metres whereas other effects have a chaining distance of 4 metres. Enemies cannot be Hit more than once in the same Chain.

entries.name: Pierce
entries.description_html: Projectiles that Pierce can pass through a target while still damaging them.
entries.description_plain: Projectiles that Pierce can pass through a target while still damaging them.

entries.name: Fork
entries.description_html: Projectiles that Fork split into two the first time they hit an enemy and do not Pierce it.
entries.description_plain: Projectiles that Fork split into two the first time they hit an enemy and do not Pierce it.

entries.name: Split
entries.description_html:
Projectiles that Split fire at a number of targets within 6 metres by splitting into multiple Projectiles the first time they Hit an enemy.

Some non-Projectile beam Skills can also Split.
entries.description_plain: Projectiles that Split fire at a number of targets within 6 metres by splitting into multiple Projectiles the first time they Hit an enemy. Some non-Projectile beam Skills can also Split.

entries.name: Deflect
entries.description_html: Deflection Rating provides a chance to Deflect damage from Hits, preventing 40% of the damage from those Hits and Ailments they inflict. Exact chance to Deflect also depends on the attacker's Accuracy.
entries.description_plain: Deflection Rating provides a chance to Deflect damage from Hits, preventing 40% of the damage from those Hits and Ailments they inflict. Exact chance to Deflect also depends on the attacker's Accuracy.

entries.name: Suppress
entries.description_html: 50% of damage from Suppressed Hits and Ailments they inflict is prevented.
entries.description_plain: 50% of damage from Suppressed Hits and Ailments they inflict is prevented.

entries.name: Block
entries.description_html:
Blocking completely prevents the damage of an incoming Hit.

You will still take any Stun from the Blocked hit. You can't Block while Stunned or Frozen.

Some skills used by Bosses cannot be blocked. These are indicated by a red glow and audio cue during the windup of the skill.
entries.description_plain: Blocking completely prevents the damage of an incoming Hit. You will still take any Stun from the Blocked hit. You can't Block while Stunned or Frozen. Some skills used by Bosses cannot be blocked. These are indicated by a red glow and audio cue during the windup of the skill.

entries.name: Chance to Block
entries.description_html: Chance to Block only includes modifiers that are explicitly chance-based. Guaranteed Block (such as raising your Shield) does not affect your Chance to Block.
entries.description_plain: Chance to Block only includes modifiers that are explicitly chance-based. Guaranteed Block (such as raising your Shield) does not affect your Chance to Block.

entries.name: Overcapped Block Chance
entries.description_html: Overcapped Block Chance is the amount by which your Chance to Block exceeds your maximum Chance to Block.
entries.description_plain: Overcapped Block Chance is the amount by which your Chance to Block exceeds your maximum Chance to Block.

entries.name: Strike
entries.description_html: A Strike is a Melee attack that directly hits with weapons or body parts. Slam attacks do not count as Strikes.
entries.description_plain: A Strike is a Melee attack that directly hits with weapons or body parts. Slam attacks do not count as Strikes.

entries.name: Projectile
entries.description_html:
A Projectile is a moving Attack or Spell that usually impacts with targets when it hits them.

When a group of multiple Projectiles is fired from the same source at the same time, only one Projectile in the group can hit each target unless otherwise specified.
entries.description_plain: A Projectile is a moving Attack or Spell that usually impacts with targets when it hits them. When a group of multiple Projectiles is fired from the same source at the same time, only one Projectile in the group can hit each target unless otherwise specified.

entries.name: Resistances
entries.description_html:
Resistances reduce damage taken of the corresponding damage type Fire, Cold, Lightning or Chaos up to a Maximum. Fire, Cold and Lightning Resistances are Elemental Resistances.

Player resistances are lowered as you progress through the game, and can be improved with Equipment, Passives & Quest items.
entries.description_plain: Resistances reduce damage taken of the corresponding damage type  Fire, Cold, Lightning or Chaos  up to a Maximum. Fire, Cold and Lightning Resistances are Elemental Resistances. Player resistances are lowered as you progress through the game, and can be improved with Equipment, Passives & Quest items.

entries.name: Critical Hits
entries.description_html:
Critical Hits deal +100% extra damage (i.e. twice as much damage) by default. Critical Damage Bonuses can further modify this value.

Attacks usually use your weapon's base Critical Hit Chance, while Spells and some other skills have their base Critical Hit Chance listed on the skill.

Most modifiers to Critical Hit Chance are percentage based. For example, gaining 100% increased Critical Hit Chance on a base Critical Hit Chance of 7% would result in a final Critical Hit Chance of 14%.
entries.description_plain: Critical Hits deal +100% extra damage (i.e. twice as much damage) by default. Critical Damage Bonuses can further modify this value. Attacks usually use your weapon's base Critical Hit Chance, while Spells and some other skills have their base Critical Hit Chance listed on the skill. Most modifiers to Critical Hit Chance are percentage based. For example, gaining 100% increased Critical Hit Chance on a base Critical Hit Chance of 7% would result in a final Critical Hit Chance of 14%.

entries.name: Critical Damage Bonus
entries.description_html: Multiplies the damage dealt by Critical Hits. Default value is +100% (i.e. twice as much damage).
entries.description_plain: Multiplies the damage dealt by Critical Hits. Default value is +100% (i.e. twice as much damage).

entries.name: Jagged Ground
entries.description_html: Jagged Ground Slows the movement speed of enemies in its area by 20%.
entries.description_plain: Jagged Ground Slows the movement speed of enemies in its area by 20%.

entries.name: Totems
entries.description_html:
Totems are allied constructs which use skills for you. Totems are not Minions and their skills benefit from your stats, though they have their own defensive stats and can be damaged or killed.

Totem Limit is shared between different types of Totem by default.
entries.description_plain: Totems are allied constructs which use skills for you. Totems are not Minions and their skills benefit from your stats, though they have their own defensive stats and can be damaged or killed. Totem Limit is shared between different types of Totem by default.

entries.name: Taunt
entries.description_html: Enemies you Taunt can only target you, and deal 10% less damage with hits to anyone else. If not otherwise specified, Taunt lasts for 3 seconds.
entries.description_plain: Enemies you Taunt can only target you, and deal 10% less damage with hits to anyone else. If not otherwise specified, Taunt lasts for 3 seconds.

entries.name: Empowered Skills
entries.description_html: Empowered Skills do not have any inherent bonuses, but a number of stats and modifiers specifically apply to Empowered Skills.
entries.description_plain: Empowered Skills do not have any inherent bonuses, but a number of stats and modifiers specifically apply to Empowered Skills.

entries.name: Monster Power
entries.description_html:
Monster Power is a number that approximately reflects how strong and dangerous a monster is. An average monster has a Power of 1, strong monsters can have Power of 2 to 3, and weak monsters might have as little as 0.5, or very occasionally less. This value is then multiplied according to the monster's Rarity:

Normal: 1
Magic: 2
Rare: 5

Unique monsters always have 20 Power.
entries.description_plain: Monster Power is a number that approximately reflects how strong and dangerous a monster is. An average monster has a Power of 1, strong monsters can have Power of 2 to 3, and weak monsters might have as little as 0.5, or very occasionally less. This value is then multiplied according to the monster's Rarity: Normal: 1 Magic: 2 Rare: 5 Unique monsters always have 20 Power.

entries.name: Armour
entries.description_html:
Armour reduces Damage taken from Hits. By default, Armour only applies to Physical Damage.

Damage reduction from Armour is proportional to the amount of Damage, and is more effective at reducing smaller hits.
entries.description_plain: Armour reduces Damage taken from Hits. By default, Armour only applies to Physical Damage. Damage reduction from Armour is proportional to the amount of Damage, and is more effective at reducing smaller hits.

entries.name: Burning
entries.description_html: Burning damage is any Fire damage dealt over time, including things like Ignite.
entries.description_plain: Burning damage is any Fire damage dealt over time, including things like Ignite.

entries.name: Frozen
entries.description_html: A Frozen target cannot move or act. Targets become Frozen when they reach 100% Freeze buildup.
entries.description_plain: A Frozen target cannot move or act. Targets become Frozen when they reach 100% Freeze buildup.

entries.name: Evasion
entries.description_html: Evasion Rating grants a chance to Evade enemy Hits, preventing them from Hitting you at all. Exact chance to Evade also depends on the attacker's Accuracy.
entries.description_plain: Evasion Rating grants a chance to Evade enemy Hits, preventing them from Hitting you at all. Exact chance to Evade also depends on the attacker's Accuracy.

entries.name: Accuracy
entries.description_html:
Accuracy is used to hit a target with an Attack, and is checked against the targets Evasion to determine that chance.

Player Attacks incur an Accuracy penalty based on distance from the origin of the damage to the target, with no penalty for targets within 2 metres and up to 90% less Accuracy for targets further than 9 metres away.
entries.description_plain: Accuracy is used to hit a target with an Attack, and is checked against the targets Evasion to determine that chance. Player Attacks incur an Accuracy penalty based on distance from the origin of the damage to the target, with no penalty for targets within 2 metres and up to 90% less Accuracy for targets further than 9 metres away.

entries.name: Energy Shield
entries.description_html:
Energy Shield protects your Life by taking damage instead. Rapidly Recharges if you don't lose Energy Shield for a short time.
Chaos damage removes twice as much Energy Shield.
Damage from Bleeding and Poison bypasses Energy Shield to remove Life directly.
entries.description_plain: Energy Shield protects your Life by taking damage instead. Rapidly Recharges if you don't lose Energy Shield for a short time. Chaos damage removes twice as much Energy Shield. Damage from Bleeding and Poison bypasses Energy Shield to remove Life directly.

entries.name: Primed for Electrocution
entries.description_html: Normal enemies are Primed for Electrocution when they have at least 40% Electrocution buildup. Magic enemies are instead Primed at 50% buildup, Rare at 60%, and Unique at 70%.
entries.description_plain: Normal enemies are Primed for Electrocution when they have at least 40% Electrocution buildup. Magic enemies are instead Primed at 50% buildup, Rare at 60%, and Unique at 70%.

entries.name: Primed for Stun
entries.description_html: Normal enemies are Primed for Stun when they have at least 40% Heavy Stun buildup. Magic enemies are instead Primed at 50% buildup, Rare at 60%, and Unique at 70%.
entries.description_plain: Normal enemies are Primed for Stun when they have at least 40% Heavy Stun buildup. Magic enemies are instead Primed at 50% buildup, Rare at 60%, and Unique at 70%.

entries.name: Primed for Freeze
entries.description_html: Normal enemies are Primed for Freeze when they have at least 40% Freeze buildup. Magic enemies are instead Primed at 50% buildup, Rare at 60%, and Unique at 70%.
entries.description_plain: Normal enemies are Primed for Freeze when they have at least 40% Freeze buildup. Magic enemies are instead Primed at 50% buildup, Rare at 60%, and Unique at 70%.

entries.name: Iron Reflexes
entries.description_html: Converts all Evasion Rating to Armour.
entries.description_plain: Converts all Evasion Rating to Armour.

entries.name: Slow
entries.description_html:
Slows are modifiers from Debuffs that cause actions to take longer. Slows can apply to a specific stat (such as attack speed or movement speed) if a specific type of slow is not specified, it applies to everything the affected entity does. Slows are always multiplicative with each other.

Higher Rarity enemies are less affected by Slows:

15% less Slow effect on Magic monsters
30% less Slow effect on Rare monsters
50% less Slow effect on Unique monsters

Additionally, Slows have 10% less effect on all monsters for each player in the area beyond the first and monsters cannot be slowed below 75% of their base speed.
entries.description_plain: Slows are modifiers from Debuffs that cause actions to take longer. Slows can apply to a specific stat (such as attack speed or movement speed)  if a specific type of slow is not specified, it applies to everything the affected entity does. Slows are always multiplicative with each other. Higher Rarity enemies are less affected by Slows: 15% less Slow effect on Magic monsters 30% less Slow effect on Rare monsters 50% less Slow effect on Unique monsters Additionally, Slows have 10% less effect on all monsters for each player in the area beyond the first and monsters cannot be slowed below 75% of their base speed.

entries.name: Rarity
entries.description_html: Item or monster rarity can be Normal (grey), Magic (blue), Rare (yellow) or Unique (brown). As a general rule, monsters increase in difficulty depending on their Rarity.
entries.description_plain: Item or monster rarity can be Normal (grey), Magic (blue), Rare (yellow) or Unique (brown). As a general rule, monsters increase in difficulty depending on their Rarity.

entries.name: Faster Start of Energy Shield Recharge
entries.description_html: Affects the delay before your Energy Shield starts Recharging after losing Energy Shield.
entries.description_plain: Affects the delay before your Energy Shield starts Recharging after losing Energy Shield.

entries.name: Energy Shield Recharge Rate
entries.description_html: Affects how quickly Energy Shield is recovered by Recharge once it starts Recharging.
entries.description_plain: Affects how quickly Energy Shield is recovered by Recharge once it starts Recharging.

entries.name: Hit Damage
entries.description_html:
Any damage that isn't damage over time is Hit damage.

Damaging Ailments which result from a Hit will calculate their damage from that Hit, and will not subsequently have Damage modifiers applied directly to them. As a result of this, raising Hit Damage will result in more powerful Damaging Ailments innately.
entries.description_plain: Any damage that isn't damage over time is Hit damage. Damaging Ailments which result from a Hit will calculate their damage from that Hit, and will not subsequently have Damage modifiers applied directly to them. As a result of this, raising Hit Damage will result in more powerful Damaging Ailments innately.

entries.name: Spells
entries.description_html:
Spells are skills that use raw magic to destroy your enemies. Attacks are not Spells.

Spells have their own base damage, cast speed and Critical Hit chance determined by the skill. They do not benefit from a weapon's inherent damage, attack speed or Critical Hit chance.
entries.description_plain: Spells are skills that use raw magic to destroy your enemies. Attacks are not Spells. Spells have their own base damage, cast speed and Critical Hit chance determined by the skill. They do not benefit from a weapon's inherent damage, attack speed or Critical Hit chance.

entries.name: Attacks
entries.description_html:
Attacks are skills that directly use your equipped weapon to damage enemies. Spells are not Attacks.

The base damage, attack speed and critical hit chance of an attack are determined using your weapon's stats unless a skill says otherwise.

Attacks do not necessarily deal Physical damage they can deal any damage type.
entries.description_plain: Attacks are skills that directly use your equipped weapon to damage enemies. Spells are not Attacks. The base damage, attack speed and critical hit chance of an attack are determined using your weapon's stats unless a skill says otherwise. Attacks do not necessarily deal Physical damage  they can deal any damage type.

entries.name: Traps
entries.description_html:
Traps are Two-Handed ranged weapons that require Dexterity and Intelligence to equip. Traps cannot be used to Attack directly.

Throwing a Trap places it on the ground, where it can either be detonated manually or triggered by Close by enemies depending on the Trap type.
entries.description_plain: Traps are Two-Handed ranged weapons that require Dexterity and Intelligence to equip. Traps cannot be used to Attack directly. Throwing a Trap places it on the ground, where it can either be detonated manually or triggered by Close by enemies depending on the Trap type.

entries.name: Withered
entries.description_html: Withered applies 5% increased Chaos damage Taken, and can be inflicted up to 10 times.
entries.description_plain: Withered applies 5% increased Chaos damage Taken, and can be inflicted up to 10 times.

entries.name: Crushed
entries.description_html: Crushed lowers Physical damage Reduction by 15%.
entries.description_plain: Crushed lowers Physical damage Reduction by 15%.

entries.name: Crushing Blows
entries.description_html: Crushing Blows cause a Heavy Stun on enemies that are Primed for Stun.
entries.description_plain: Crushing Blows cause a Heavy Stun on enemies that are Primed for Stun.

entries.name: Brittle
entries.description_html: Hits have up to +6% Critical Hit Chance against Brittle enemies, based on the Cold damage of the Hit which inflicted Brittle, for 4 seconds.
entries.description_plain: Hits have up to +6% Critical Hit Chance against Brittle enemies, based on the Cold damage of the Hit which inflicted Brittle, for 4 seconds.

entries.name: Quest Item
entries.description_html: Quest items are used to progress the story. They cannot be sold or stashed, but can be discarded. Discarded quest items can be reobtained from their original source.
entries.description_plain: Quest items are used to progress the story. They cannot be sold or stashed, but can be discarded. Discarded quest items can be reobtained from their original source.

entries.name: Swords
entries.description_html:
Swords are Melee weapons that can be One-Handed or Two-Handed. Swords require Strength and Dexterity to equip.

Sword Attacks are commonly related to elemental damage.
entries.description_plain: Swords are Melee weapons that can be One-Handed or Two-Handed. Swords require Strength and Dexterity to equip. Sword Attacks are commonly related to elemental damage.

entries.name: Maces
entries.description_html:
Maces are Melee weapons that can be One-Handed or Two-Handed. Maces require Strength to equip.

Mace Attacks are often Slams or slow Strikes that deal Physical or Fire damage.
entries.description_plain: Maces are Melee weapons that can be One-Handed or Two-Handed. Maces require Strength to equip. Mace Attacks are often Slams or slow Strikes that deal Physical or Fire damage.

entries.name: Sceptres
entries.description_html:
Sceptres are One-Handed weapons that require Strength and Intelligence to equip. Sceptres can be equipped in your main hand or off hand, but you cannot Dual Wield two Sceptres.

Sceptres cannot be used to Attack and do not grant bonuses to Spellcasting. Instead, they grant additional Spirit and can provide bonuses to your Allies.
entries.description_plain: Sceptres are One-Handed weapons that require Strength and Intelligence to equip. Sceptres can be equipped in your main hand or off hand, but you cannot Dual Wield two Sceptres. Sceptres cannot be used to Attack and do not grant bonuses to Spellcasting. Instead, they grant additional Spirit and can provide bonuses to your Allies.

entries.name: Wands
entries.description_html:
Wands are One-Handed Spellcasting weapons that require Intelligence to equip.

Wands cannot be Dual Wielded and cannot be used to Attack directly. However, they grant inbuilt Spells based on the wand type and powerful bonuses to spells.
entries.description_plain: Wands are One-Handed Spellcasting weapons that require Intelligence to equip. Wands cannot be Dual Wielded and cannot be used to Attack directly. However, they grant inbuilt Spells based on the wand type and powerful bonuses to spells.

entries.name: Axes
entries.description_html:
Axes are Melee weapons that can be One-Handed or Two-Handed. Axes require Strength and Dexterity to equip.

Axe Attacks commonly involve throwing your axe and/or inflicting Bleeding.
entries.description_plain: Axes are Melee weapons that can be One-Handed or Two-Handed. Axes require Strength and Dexterity to equip. Axe Attacks commonly involve throwing your axe and/or inflicting Bleeding.

entries.name: Bows
entries.description_html:
Bows are Two-Handed ranged weapons that require Dexterity to equip. Equipping a Bow allows you to also equip a Quiver in the off hand slot.

Bows can Attack from long range and with high mobility using a variety of skills, but generally deal less damage than other two-handed weapon types.
entries.description_plain: Bows are Two-Handed ranged weapons that require Dexterity to equip. Equipping a Bow allows you to also equip a Quiver in the off hand slot. Bows can Attack from long range and with high mobility using a variety of skills, but generally deal less damage than other two-handed weapon types.

entries.name: Daggers
entries.description_html:
Daggers are One-Handed Melee weapons that require Dexterity and Intelligence to equip.

Dagger Attacks are commonly related to ambushing or debilitating enemies. Some blade-related Spells also require a Dagger.
entries.description_plain: Daggers are One-Handed Melee weapons that require Dexterity and Intelligence to equip. Dagger Attacks are commonly related to ambushing or debilitating enemies. Some blade-related Spells also require a Dagger.

entries.name: Staves
entries.description_html:
Staves are Two-Handed Spellcasting weapons that require Intelligence to equip.
Staves cannot be used to Attack. However, they grant inbuilt Spells based on the staff type and powerful bonuses to spells.
entries.description_plain: Staves are Two-Handed Spellcasting weapons that require Intelligence to equip. Staves cannot be used to Attack. However, they grant inbuilt Spells based on the staff type and powerful bonuses to spells.

entries.name: Claws
entries.description_html:
Claws are One-Handed Melee weapons that require Dexterity to equip. Claws can be Dual Wielded with another Claw, but cannot be combined with other equipped items in the off hand.

Claw Attacks are commonly fast and cause Bleeding.
entries.description_plain: Claws are One-Handed Melee weapons that require Dexterity to equip. Claws can be Dual Wielded with another Claw, but cannot be combined with other equipped items in the off hand. Claw Attacks are commonly fast and cause Bleeding.

entries.name: Talismans
entries.description_html:
Talismans are Two-Handed Melee weapons that require Strength and Intelligence to equip.

Talismans allow you to use Shapeshifting Skills. Although each Talisman is associated with a specific Shapeshift form, every Talisman allows you to use Skills from all forms.
entries.description_plain: Talismans are Two-Handed Melee weapons that require Strength and Intelligence to equip. Talismans allow you to use Shapeshifting Skills. Although each Talisman is associated with a specific Shapeshift form, every Talisman allows you to use Skills from all forms.

entries.name: Shields
entries.description_html:
Shields are armour items that are equipped in your off hand. While holding a Shield you have a chance to passively Block. Most Shields can also be raised to Block all incoming Strikes and Projectiles from the front.

Bucklers are a special type of Shield that do not grant any Armour and can Parry enemy skills instead of being raised to Block.
entries.description_plain: Shields are armour items that are equipped in your off hand. While holding a Shield you have a chance to passively Block. Most Shields can also be raised to Block all incoming Strikes and Projectiles from the front. Bucklers are a special type of Shield that do not grant any Armour and can Parry enemy skills instead of being raised to Block.

entries.name: Armoured Shields
entries.description_html: Armoured Shields are any Shields that grant the player Armour that is, any type of Shield other than Bucklers.
entries.description_plain: Armoured Shields are any Shields that grant the player Armour  that is, any type of Shield other than Bucklers.

entries.name: Bucklers
entries.description_html: Bucklers are a special type of Shield that do not grant any Armour and can Parry enemy skills instead of being raised to Block.
entries.description_plain: Bucklers are a special type of Shield that do not grant any Armour and can Parry enemy skills instead of being raised to Block.

entries.name: Foci
entries.description_html:
Foci are armour items that are equipped in your off hand and require Intelligence to equip.

Foci can grant significant amounts of Energy Shield and powerful bonuses to your Spells.
entries.description_plain: Foci are armour items that are equipped in your off hand and require Intelligence to equip. Foci can grant significant amounts of Energy Shield and powerful bonuses to your Spells.

entries.name: Quarterstaves
entries.description_html:
Quarterstaves are Two-Handed Melee weapons that require Dexterity and Intelligence to equip.

Quarterstaff Attacks often focus on high mobility in combat.
entries.description_plain: Quarterstaves are Two-Handed Melee weapons that require Dexterity and Intelligence to equip. Quarterstaff Attacks often focus on high mobility in combat.

entries.name: Spears
entries.description_html:
Spears are One-Handed Melee weapons that require Strength and Dexterity to equip. Spears cannot be dual wielded.

Spear combat is often a mix of both ranged and Melee, as many spear skills enable you to throw your spear.
entries.description_plain: Spears are One-Handed Melee weapons that require Strength and Dexterity to equip. Spears cannot be dual wielded. Spear combat is often a mix of both ranged and Melee, as many spear skills enable you to throw your spear.

entries.name: Crossbows
entries.description_html:
Crossbows are Two-Handed ranged weapons that require Strength and Dexterity to equip. Crossbow basic Attacks can be modified with Ammunition Skills.

Multiple Projectiles fired from a single Crossbow skill can all hit the same target, and single-Projectile skills fire additional Projectiles in sequence rather than in a spread.
entries.description_plain: Crossbows are Two-Handed ranged weapons that require Strength and Dexterity to equip. Crossbow basic Attacks can be modified with Ammunition Skills. Multiple Projectiles fired from a single Crossbow skill can all hit the same target, and single-Projectile skills fire additional Projectiles in sequence rather than in a spread.

entries.name: Flails
entries.description_html:
Flails are One-Handed Melee weapons that require Strength and Intelligence to equip. Flails cannot be Dual Wielded.

Flail Attacks tend to reward careful placement and long wind-up times with devastating effects.
entries.description_plain: Flails are One-Handed Melee weapons that require Strength and Intelligence to equip. Flails cannot be Dual Wielded. Flail Attacks tend to reward careful placement and long wind-up times with devastating effects.

entries.name: Flasks
entries.description_html:
Flasks can be used to recover your Life or Mana. Flasks are not consumable, but require charges to use. Flask charges can be regained by killing enemies.

Normal enemies grant Flask charges equal to half their Power
Magic enemies grant Flask charges equal to their Power
Rare and Unique enemies grant Flask charges equal to twice their Power

Checkpoints and Wells completely refill Flasks when activated. Flasks can only hold charges while in a Flask slot.
entries.description_plain: Flasks can be used to recover your Life or Mana. Flasks are not consumable, but require charges to use. Flask charges can be regained by killing enemies. Normal enemies grant Flask charges equal to half their Power Magic enemies grant Flask charges equal to their Power Rare and Unique enemies grant Flask charges equal to twice their Power Checkpoints and Wells completely refill Flasks when activated. Flasks can only hold charges while in a Flask slot.

entries.name: Utility Flasks
entries.description_html:
Utility Flasks can only hold charges while in a flask slot. They can be bound to action buttons to trigger strategically during combat. Utility Flasks offer a buff or combat ability for a limited time.

Flasks refill at Checkpoints, Wells or by killing Monsters. More powerful Monsters will grant more charges.
entries.description_plain: Utility Flasks can only hold charges while in a flask slot. They can be bound to action buttons to trigger strategically during combat. Utility Flasks offer a buff or combat ability for a limited time. Flasks refill at Checkpoints, Wells or by killing Monsters. More powerful Monsters will grant more charges.

entries.name: Quivers
entries.description_html: Quivers are off hand items that are only usable while you have a Bow equipped. Quivers provide a variety of bonuses to Bow Attacks.
entries.description_plain: Quivers are off hand items that are only usable while you have a Bow equipped. Quivers provide a variety of bonuses to Bow Attacks.

entries.name: Spirit
entries.description_html:
Spirit is a reserve of power used to activate and maintain skills with permanent effects. Spirit-powered skills are managed within the Skills Panel.

Weapon Sets can have differing amounts of available Spirit, due to weapons with Spirit (such as Sceptres), Weapon Set Passive Skills, or Persistent Skills that are active in specific Weapon Sets.
entries.description_plain: Spirit is a reserve of power used to activate and maintain skills with permanent effects. Spirit-powered skills are managed within the Skills Panel. Weapon Sets can have differing amounts of available Spirit, due to weapons with Spirit (such as Sceptres), Weapon Set Passive Skills, or Persistent Skills that are active in specific Weapon Sets.

entries.name: One-Handed
entries.description_html: One-handed weapons can be placed in the main weapon slot. Some one-handed weapon types can be dual wielded in both main and off hand weapon slots.
entries.description_plain: One-handed weapons can be placed in the main weapon slot. Some one-handed weapon types can be dual wielded in both main and off hand weapon slots.

entries.name: Two-Handed
entries.description_html: Two-handed weapons take up both weapon slots when equipped.
entries.description_plain: Two-handed weapons take up both weapon slots when equipped.

entries.name: Allies
entries.description_html:
Your allies include other players, Minions, and any other entity that fights alongside you and has its own stats.

You do not count as your own Ally.
entries.description_plain: Your allies include other players, Minions, and any other entity that fights alongside you and has its own stats. You do not count as your own Ally.

entries.name: Dual Wielding
entries.description_html: Dual Wielding refers to using two Martial Weapons, one in each hand.
entries.description_plain: Dual Wielding refers to using two Martial Weapons, one in each hand.

entries.name: Minions
entries.description_html: Minions are summoned Allies which will accompany and fight alongside you. Persistent Minions will reserve a portion of Spirit while active.
entries.description_plain: Minions are summoned Allies which will accompany and fight alongside you. Persistent Minions will reserve a portion of Spirit while active.

entries.name: Warcries
entries.description_html: Warcries are skills which count enemy Power within their area and Empower your subsequent Melee Attacks, sometimes depending on the total Power of enemies counted.
entries.description_plain: Warcries are skills which count enemy Power within their area and Empower your subsequent Melee Attacks, sometimes depending on the total Power of enemies counted.

entries.name: Curses
entries.description_html:
Curses significantly Debuff affected targets. By default a target can have one Curse on them at a time.

Higher Rarity enemies are less affected by Curses:

15% less Curse effect on Magic monsters
30% less Curse effect on Rare monsters
50% less Curse effect on Unique monsters
entries.description_plain: Curses significantly Debuff affected targets. By default a target can have one Curse on them at a time. Higher Rarity enemies are less affected by Curses: 15% less Curse effect on Magic monsters 30% less Curse effect on Rare monsters 50% less Curse effect on Unique monsters

entries.name: Aftershocks
entries.description_html: Aftershocks are bursts of area damage that occur after the initial impact of the skill causing them. If not otherwise specified, the Aftershock will deal the same damage as the initial impact, in the same area.
entries.description_plain: Aftershocks are bursts of area damage that occur after the initial impact of the skill causing them. If not otherwise specified, the Aftershock will deal the same damage as the initial impact, in the same area.

entries.name: Elusive
entries.description_html: The Elusive buff grants increased Movement Speed, and additional chance to avoid damage. The effects of Elusive are reduced over time.
entries.description_plain: The Elusive buff grants increased Movement Speed, and additional chance to avoid damage. The effects of Elusive are reduced over time.

entries.name: Shocked Ground
entries.description_html: Shocked Ground Shocks those standing in it, and lasts 6 seconds by default.
entries.description_plain: Shocked Ground Shocks those standing in it, and lasts 6 seconds by default.

entries.name: Energy Shield Leech
entries.description_html:
When you deal damage from a Hit, Leech causes you to recover an amount of the stated resource equal to a percentage of the damage you dealt.
Monsters have Leech Resistance that increases with monster level, reducing how much you recover from Leech.
Leeched Energy Shield is recovered over one second. Multiple Leeches can occur simultaneously. Modifiers specific to Life Leech will not apply to Energy Shield Leech.
entries.description_plain: When you deal damage from a Hit, Leech causes you to recover an amount of the stated resource equal to a percentage of the damage you dealt. Monsters have Leech Resistance that increases with monster level, reducing how much you recover from Leech. Leeched Energy Shield is recovered over one second. Multiple Leeches can occur simultaneously. Modifiers specific to Life Leech will not apply to Energy Shield Leech.

entries.name: Unarmed
entries.description_html: Unarmed Attacks do not benefit from your equipped Weapon.
entries.description_plain: Unarmed Attacks do not benefit from your equipped Weapon.

entries.name: Orb Skills
entries.description_html: Orb Skills create lasting effects at a location which damage enemies in an area around them.
entries.description_plain: Orb Skills create lasting effects at a location which damage enemies in an area around them.

entries.name: Exposure
entries.description_html:
Exposure is a type of Debuff that lowers the affected enemy's Total Elemental Resistances. By default it lowers Resistances by -20% and lasts for 4 seconds, though some sources of exposure can override these values. Like most sources of lowering Resistances, this can cause the enemy's Resistance to become negative.

Higher Rarity enemies are less affected by Exposure:

15% less Exposure effect on Magic monsters
30% less Exposure effect on Rare monsters
50% less Exposure effect on Unique monsters
entries.description_plain: Exposure is a type of Debuff that lowers the affected enemy's Total Elemental Resistances. By default it lowers Resistances by -20% and lasts for 4 seconds, though some sources of exposure can override these values. Like most sources of lowering Resistances, this can cause the enemy's Resistance to become negative. Higher Rarity enemies are less affected by Exposure: 15% less Exposure effect on Magic monsters 30% less Exposure effect on Rare monsters 50% less Exposure effect on Unique monsters

entries.name: Energy
entries.description_html:
Several Meta Skills generate and use Energy. Each Skill which generates Energy has its own Energy count particular to that Skill. Most effects which use Energy do so to Trigger other effects or Skills, based on the use time of the triggered Skill. When calculating Energy gain or consumption from the use time of a Skill, modifiers to Total use time are treated as though they were double the value.

Energy cannot be gained from direct effects of Triggered Skills.
entries.description_plain: Several Meta Skills generate and use Energy. Each Skill which generates Energy has its own Energy count particular to that Skill. Most effects which use Energy do so to Trigger other effects or Skills, based on the use time of the triggered Skill. When calculating Energy gain or consumption from the use time of a Skill, modifiers to Total use time are treated as though they were double the value. Energy cannot be gained from direct effects of Triggered Skills.

entries.name: Ice Crystals
entries.description_html:
Ice Crystals are solid blocks of ice which can be damaged. When destroyed, Ice Crystals will deal Cold damage in an area. Ice Crystals will block the movement of smaller monsters, while larger monsters will destroy Ice Crystals in their path.

Skills which Consume Freeze will instantly shatter Ice Crystals, causing them to deal more damage in a larger area.
entries.description_plain: Ice Crystals are solid blocks of ice which can be damaged. When destroyed, Ice Crystals will deal Cold damage in an area. Ice Crystals will block the movement of smaller monsters, while larger monsters will destroy Ice Crystals in their path. Skills which Consume Freeze will instantly shatter Ice Crystals, causing them to deal more damage in a larger area.

entries.name: Ice Crystal Shattering
entries.description_html: Skills which Consume Freeze will instantly shatter Ice Crystals, causing them to deal more damage in a larger area.
entries.description_plain: Skills which Consume Freeze will instantly shatter Ice Crystals, causing them to deal more damage in a larger area.

entries.name: Returning
entries.description_html: Projectiles which Return will Return to the entity which originated them after reaching the end of their travel, or on hitting a final target.
entries.description_plain: Projectiles which Return will Return to the entity which originated them after reaching the end of their travel, or on hitting a final target.

entries.name: Phasing
entries.description_html: While Phasing, you can pass through enemies without being blocked by them.
entries.description_plain: While Phasing, you can pass through enemies without being blocked by them.

entries.name: Corpses
entries.description_html: Corpses are left behind by slain Enemies and can be used or consumed by a number of different Skills or effects, though Corpses of Unique monsters cannot be destroyed or consumed. Generally, slain Allies do not leave usable Corpses.
entries.description_plain: Corpses are left behind by slain Enemies and can be used or consumed by a number of different Skills or effects, though Corpses of Unique monsters cannot be destroyed or consumed. Generally, slain Allies do not leave usable Corpses.

entries.name: Charges
entries.description_html:
Charges can be gained from a number of Skills, passives, and other effects. They do not grant any inherent benefits, but can be consumed to fuel many skills and other effects. Charges last for 15 seconds by default, refreshing whenever you gain another charge of the same type.

There are three types of Charges Endurance, Frenzy and Power. By default players can have up to 3 of each type of Charge at once.
entries.description_plain: Charges can be gained from a number of Skills, passives, and other effects. They do not grant any inherent benefits, but can be consumed to fuel many skills and other effects. Charges last for 15 seconds by default, refreshing whenever you gain another charge of the same type. There are three types of Charges  Endurance, Frenzy and Power. By default players can have up to 3 of each type of Charge at once.

entries.name: Elemental Damage Types
entries.description_html: The three Elemental damage types are Fire, Cold, and Lightning.
entries.description_plain: The three Elemental damage types are Fire, Cold, and Lightning.

entries.name: Wells
entries.description_html: Wells are present in every Town, and will refill your Flasks as well as restoring your Life and Mana when used.
entries.description_plain: Wells are present in every Town, and will refill your Flasks as well as restoring your Life and Mana when used.

entries.name: Presence
entries.description_html: Your Presence is an area around your character within which certain effects (such as many Auras) are applied. By default this has a 4 metre radius. The size of this area can be modified by Presence Area modifiers, but not by Skill Area modifiers.
entries.description_plain: Your Presence is an area around your character within which certain effects (such as many Auras) are applied. By default this has a 4 metre radius. The size of this area can be modified by Presence Area modifiers, but not by Skill Area modifiers.

entries.name: Light Radius
entries.description_html: Your Light Radius determines the distance from your character which will be illuminated in dark areas, and the radius within which terrain and points of interest are revealed on the map.
entries.description_plain: Your Light Radius determines the distance from your character which will be illuminated in dark areas, and the radius within which terrain and points of interest are revealed on the map.

entries.name: Item Rarity
entries.description_html:
Items can be Normal (grey), Magic (blue), Rare (yellow) or Unique (brown). Item Classes which do not have these rarities, such as Currency, have individual rarity for each item.
Magic items can have 2 Modifiers; a Prefix and a Suffix.
Rare items can have up to 6 Modifiers; 3 Prefixes and 3 Suffixes.
More powerful and dangerous enemies are more likely to drop rarer Items.
entries.description_plain: Items can be Normal (grey), Magic (blue), Rare (yellow) or Unique (brown). Item Classes which do not have these rarities, such as Currency, have individual rarity for each item. Magic items can have 2 Modifiers; a Prefix and a Suffix. Rare items can have up to 6 Modifiers; 3 Prefixes and 3 Suffixes. More powerful and dangerous enemies are more likely to drop rarer Items.

entries.name: Shatter
entries.description_html: Frozen enemies Shatter when killed, destroying their corpse.
entries.description_plain: Frozen enemies Shatter when killed, destroying their corpse.

entries.name: Resistance Penetration
entries.description_html:
Penetration causes the target's corresponding Resistance to be treated as lower than its actual value by the specified amount when of calculating Damage taken from your Hits. Resistances can only be Penetrated down to a minimum of 0% by default.

Since Penetration only affects Hits and applies to the target's defensive stats rather than your own offensive stats, it does not affect damage with Ailments.
entries.description_plain: Penetration causes the target's corresponding Resistance to be treated as lower than its actual value by the specified amount when of calculating Damage taken from your Hits. Resistances can only be Penetrated down to a minimum of 0% by default. Since Penetration only affects Hits and applies to the target's defensive stats rather than your own offensive stats, it does not affect damage with Ailments.

entries.name: Armour Break
entries.description_html:
Some Skills, Items, Support Gems and other effects can Break Armour, which lowers a target's Armour by a specified amount. If this brings the target's Armour value to 0, their Armour is Fully Broken for 12 seconds, or 4 seconds for players. On top of not benefitting from Armour, non-player targets with Fully Broken Armour take 20% increased Physical damage from Hits.

Players Break 3 times Armour against Normal Monsters and 2 times Armour against Magic Monsters.
entries.description_plain: Some Skills, Items, Support Gems and other effects can Break Armour, which lowers a target's Armour by a specified amount. If this brings the target's Armour value to 0, their Armour is Fully Broken for 12 seconds, or 4 seconds for players. On top of not benefitting from Armour, non-player targets with Fully Broken Armour take 20% increased Physical damage from Hits. Players Break 3 times Armour against Normal Monsters and 2 times Armour against Magic Monsters.

entries.name: Armour Break below 0
entries.description_html: Enemies with Armour Broken below 0 have negative Armour. This means they take more Physical damage from Hits. Armour broken below 0 is capped by the enemy's base Armour.
entries.description_plain: Enemies with Armour Broken below 0 have negative Armour. This means they take more Physical damage from Hits. Armour broken below 0 is capped by the enemy's base Armour.

entries.name: Channelling
entries.description_html: Channelling Skills can be held down to gain power or continue using the Skill for a longer period of time.
entries.description_plain: Channelling Skills can be held down to gain power or continue using the Skill for a longer period of time.

entries.name: Remote Skills
entries.description_html: Remote Skills are Skills that are performed for you by a different entity, such as a Totem, Trap, or Clone. Minions are not Remote Skills.
entries.description_plain: Remote Skills are Skills that are performed for you by a different entity, such as a Totem, Trap, or Clone. Minions are not Remote Skills.

entries.name: Ancestral Boost
entries.description_html: An Ancestrally Boosted Slam has 30% more damage and 25% increased area of effect, and an Ancestrally Boosted Strike will target 2 additional Enemies. Triggered Skills cannot be Ancestrally Boosted. Ancestrally Boosted Attacks count as being Empowered.
entries.description_plain: An Ancestrally Boosted Slam has 30% more damage and 25% increased area of effect, and an Ancestrally Boosted Strike will target 2 additional Enemies. Triggered Skills cannot be Ancestrally Boosted. Ancestrally Boosted Attacks count as being Empowered.

entries.name: Buffs
entries.description_html:
