Buffs are effects that boost a player or monster's stats for a duration or while a condition is met.

Unless otherwise stated, Buffs of the same type do not stack only the copy with the strongest effect applies.
entries.description_plain: Buffs are effects that boost a player or monster's stats for a duration or while a condition is met. Unless otherwise stated, Buffs of the same type do not stack  only the copy with the strongest effect applies.

entries.name: Debuffs
entries.description_html:
Debuffs are negative effects that deal damage or penalise an entity's stats, either for a set duration or when a condition is met.

Unless otherwise stated, Debuffs of the same type do not stack only the copy with the strongest effect applies.
entries.description_plain: Debuffs are negative effects that deal damage or penalise an entity's stats, either for a set duration or when a condition is met. Unless otherwise stated, Debuffs of the same type do not stack  only the copy with the strongest effect applies.

entries.name: Persistent Skills
entries.description_html: Persistent Skills are toggled in the Skills Panel instead of being used normally and often need to Reserve Spirit in order to be activated.
entries.description_plain: Persistent Skills are toggled in the Skills Panel instead of being used normally and often need to Reserve Spirit in order to be activated.

entries.name: Effect Consumption
entries.description_html:
Multiple effects on enemies can be Consumed. Only one Consumption benefit can occur at once, and Consumption effects from Skills will take priority over those from other sources.

Consuming a Debuff on an enemy causes the enemy to be immune to that Debuff for 1 seconds.
entries.description_plain: Multiple effects on enemies can be Consumed. Only one Consumption benefit can occur at once, and Consumption effects from Skills will take priority over those from other sources. Consuming a Debuff on an enemy causes the enemy to be immune to that Debuff for 1 seconds.

entries.name: Chaos Orb
entries.description_html: Removes a random modifier and augments a Rare item with a new random modifier.
entries.description_plain: Removes a random modifier and augments a Rare item with a new random modifier.

entries.name: Orb of Alteration
entries.description_html: Reforges a Magic item with new random modifiers.
entries.description_plain: Reforges a Magic item with new random modifiers.

entries.name: Orb of Transmutation
entries.description_html: Upgrades a Normal item to a Magic item with 1 modifier.
entries.description_plain: Upgrades a Normal item to a Magic item with 1 modifier.

entries.name: Orb of Alchemy
entries.description_html: Upgrades a Normal item to a Rare item with 4 modifiers.
entries.description_plain: Upgrades a Normal item to a Rare item with 4 modifiers.

entries.name: Orb of Chance
entries.description_html: Unpredictably either upgrades a Normal item to Unique rarity or destroys it.
entries.description_plain: Unpredictably either upgrades a Normal item to Unique rarity or destroys it.

entries.name: Regal Orb
entries.description_html: Upgrades a Magic item to a Rare item
entries.description_plain: Upgrades a Magic item to a Rare item

entries.name: Artificer's Orb
entries.description_html: Adds a Rune Socket to a Martial Weapon or Armour
entries.description_plain: Adds a Rune Socket to a Martial Weapon or Armour

entries.name: Auras
entries.description_html: Auras apply Buffs to Allies within a radius, or Debuffs to enemies within a radius of the source of the Aura.
entries.description_plain: Auras apply Buffs to Allies within a radius, or Debuffs to enemies within a radius of the source of the Aura.

entries.name: Stormsurge
entries.description_html: Each Stormsurge on this Weapon grants 3% of damage Gained as Extra Lightning damage for 5 seconds. Maximum 10 Stormsurge.
entries.description_plain: Each Stormsurge on this Weapon grants 3% of damage Gained as Extra Lightning damage for 5 seconds. Maximum 10 Stormsurge.

entries.name: Reviving Minions
entries.description_html: Reviving Minions heal after avoiding damage for a short time, and automatically revive after a short delay when killed. This delay is reset whenever another Reviving Minion dies.
entries.description_plain: Reviving Minions heal after avoiding damage for a short time, and automatically revive after a short delay when killed. This delay is reset whenever another Reviving Minion dies.

entries.name: Quality
entries.description_html:
Quality grants small bonuses to an item depending on the type of item.

Martial Weapons gain 1% more Physical damage per Quality.
Armours gain 1% more Defences per Quality.
Rings and Amulets have a number of possible quality types that provide bonuses to specific modifiers on the item.
Flasks gain 1% more Life and Mana recovery per Quality.
Charms gain 1% increased duration per Quality.
Skill Gems or equipment that grant Skills grant a specific bonus to their Skill based on their Quality.
entries.description_plain: Quality grants small bonuses to an item depending on the type of item. Martial Weapons gain 1% more Physical damage per Quality. Armours gain 1% more Defences per Quality. Rings and Amulets have a number of possible quality types that provide bonuses to specific modifiers on the item. Flasks gain 1% more Life and Mana recovery per Quality. Charms gain 1% increased duration per Quality. Skill Gems or equipment that grant Skills grant a specific bonus to their Skill based on their Quality.

entries.name: Support Gems
entries.description_html:
Support Gems can be inserted into sockets on a Skill Gem in order to modify the effects of that Skill. They only apply to the Skill Gem they are socketed into.

You cannot use multiple copies of the exact same Lineage Support across multiple Skills, or for Supports that grant global benefits to persistent reservation Skills while active.
Cannot use multiple Support Gems of the same Category in one Skill.
entries.description_plain: Support Gems can be inserted into sockets on a Skill Gem in order to modify the effects of that Skill. They only apply to the Skill Gem they are socketed into. You cannot use multiple copies of the exact same Lineage Support across multiple Skills, or for Supports that grant global benefits to persistent reservation Skills while active. Cannot use multiple Support Gems of the same Category in one Skill.

entries.name: Area of Effect Skills
entries.description_html:
This Skill has an effect that applies to every target in its area, rather than picking specific targets.

Areas of Effect that originate from a target hit by a Skill will add that target's size to their radius.
entries.description_plain: This Skill has an effect that applies to every target in its area, rather than picking specific targets. Areas of Effect that originate from a target hit by a Skill will add that target's size to their radius.

entries.name: Duration Skills
entries.description_html: This Skill has a Duration that can be modified.
entries.description_plain: This Skill has a Duration that can be modified.

entries.name: Detonator Skills
entries.description_html: Detonator Skills can cause flammable gas, Oil, explosives, and similar effects to explode on contact.
entries.description_plain: Detonator Skills can cause flammable gas, Oil, explosives, and similar effects to explode on contact.

entries.name: Nova Skills
entries.description_html: Nova Skills take effect in a circular area around their user.
entries.description_plain: Nova Skills take effect in a circular area around their user.

entries.name: Triggered Skills
entries.description_html:
Many effects can cause a Skill to Trigger. A Triggered Skill occurs immediately, without an attack or cast time, and usually targets the cause of the trigger. Triggering a Skill does not count as using it.

If multiple methods of Triggering a skill attempt to apply to the same skill, that skill will be disabled.
entries.description_plain: Many effects can cause a Skill to Trigger. A Triggered Skill occurs immediately, without an attack or cast time, and usually targets the cause of the trigger. Triggering a Skill does not count as using it. If multiple methods of Triggering a skill attempt to apply to the same skill, that skill will be disabled.

entries.name: Herald Skills
entries.description_html: Herald Skills are a type of Persistent Buff that grant powerful effects on killing enemies.
entries.description_plain: Herald Skills are a type of Persistent Buff that grant powerful effects on killing enemies.

entries.name: Recoup
entries.description_html: When you take damage from a Hit, Recoup causes you to recover an amount of the stated resource equal to a percentage of the damage you took over 8 seconds.
entries.description_plain: When you take damage from a Hit, Recoup causes you to recover an amount of the stated resource equal to a percentage of the damage you took over 8 seconds.

entries.name: Thorns
entries.description_html:
Thorns damage is a kind of Hit Damage you can deal. Thorns damage is not Attack damage or Spell damage and is not affected by modifiers specific to those.

If you have Thorns damage, you inherently Retaliate against Melee Attack Hits, dealing your Thorns damage to the enemy that Hit you.

Some skills and other effects may also deal your thorns damage to enemies at other times.
entries.description_plain: Thorns damage is a kind of Hit Damage you can deal. Thorns damage is not Attack damage or Spell damage and is not affected by modifiers specific to those. If you have Thorns damage, you inherently Retaliate against Melee Attack Hits, dealing your Thorns damage to the enemy that Hit you. Some skills and other effects may also deal your thorns damage to enemies at other times.

entries.name: Ignited Ground
entries.description_html: Ignited Ground repeatedly inflicts Flammability on enemies as long as they are standing on it, Igniting them when it reaches 100%. By default, Ignited Ground lasts for 4 seconds and has a radius of 2 metres unless otherwise specified.
entries.description_plain: Ignited Ground repeatedly inflicts Flammability on enemies as long as they are standing on it, Igniting them when it reaches 100%. By default, Ignited Ground lasts for 4 seconds and has a radius of 2 metres unless otherwise specified.

entries.name: Critical Weakness
entries.description_html: Critical Weakness causes hits against affected targets to have +0.5% to Critical Hit Chance, and can stack up to 20 times. If not otherwise specified, each stack lasts for 4 seconds.
entries.description_plain: Critical Weakness causes hits against affected targets to have +0.5% to Critical Hit Chance, and can stack up to 20 times. If not otherwise specified, each stack lasts for 4 seconds.

entries.name: Elemental Ground Surfaces
entries.description_html: Elemental Ground Surface include Shocked Ground, Chilled Ground, and Ignited Ground.
entries.description_plain: Elemental Ground Surface include Shocked Ground, Chilled Ground, and Ignited Ground.

entries.name: Crossbow Ammunition Skills
entries.description_html: Using a Crossbow Ammunition Skill replaces your Crossbow's basic Attack with the skill indicated. The Ammunition Skill itself does not fire the Ammunition, only load it into your Crossbow. Most Crossbow Ammunition Skills that directly Hit enemies have Knockback.
entries.description_plain: Using a Crossbow Ammunition Skill replaces your Crossbow's basic Attack with the skill indicated. The Ammunition Skill itself does not fire the Ammunition, only load it into your Crossbow. Most Crossbow Ammunition Skills that directly Hit enemies have Knockback.

entries.name: Monster Modifiers
entries.description_html:
Magic and Rare Monsters can have Modifiers which will augment them in many dangerous ways, making them more powerful and deadly foes.

Magic Monsters will only ever have a single Monster Modifier, whereas Rare Monsters can have multiple.
entries.description_plain: Magic and Rare Monsters can have Modifiers which will augment them in many dangerous ways, making them more powerful and deadly foes. Magic Monsters will only ever have a single Monster Modifier, whereas Rare Monsters can have multiple.

entries.name: Unwavering Stance
entries.description_html:
Cannot be Light Stunned
Cannot Dodge Roll or Sprint
entries.description_plain: Cannot be Light Stunned Cannot Dodge Roll or Sprint

entries.name: Eldritch Battery
entries.description_html:
Converts all Energy Shield to Mana
Doubles Mana Costs
entries.description_plain: Converts all Energy Shield to Mana Doubles Mana Costs

entries.name: Mind over Matter
entries.description_html:
All Damage is taken from Mana before Life
50% less Mana Recovery Rate
entries.description_plain: All Damage is taken from Mana before Life 50% less Mana Recovery Rate

entries.name: Blood Magic
entries.description_html:
You have no Mana
Skill Mana Costs Converted to Life Costs
entries.description_plain: You have no Mana Skill Mana Costs Converted to Life Costs

entries.name: Giant's Blood
entries.description_html:
You can wield Two-Handed Axes, Maces and Swords in one hand
Triple Attribute requirements of weapons
Inherent Life granted by Strength is halved
entries.description_plain: You can wield Two-Handed Axes, Maces and Swords in one hand Triple Attribute requirements of weapons Inherent Life granted by Strength is halved

entries.name: Vaal Pact
entries.description_html:
Life Leech is Instant
Cannot use Life Flasks
entries.description_plain: Life Leech is Instant Cannot use Life Flasks

entries.name: Pain Attunement
entries.description_html:
30% less Critical Damage Bonus when on Full Life
30% more Critical Damage Bonus when on Low Life
entries.description_plain: 30% less Critical Damage Bonus when on Full Life 30% more Critical Damage Bonus when on Low Life

entries.name: Hex Master
entries.description_html:
You can apply an additional Curse
Double Activation Delay of Curses
entries.description_plain: You can apply an additional Curse Double Activation Delay of Curses

entries.name: Glancing Blows
entries.description_html:
Chance to Evade is Unlucky
Chance to Deflect is Lucky
entries.description_plain: Chance to Evade is Unlucky Chance to Deflect is Lucky

entries.name: Ancestral Bond
entries.description_html:
Unlimited number of Summoned Totems
Totems reserve 100 Spirit each
entries.description_plain: Unlimited number of Summoned Totems Totems reserve 100 Spirit each

entries.name: Conduit
entries.description_html: When you generate an Endurance, Frenzy or Power Charge, Allies in your Presence generate that Charge instead
entries.description_plain: When you generate an Endurance, Frenzy or Power Charge, Allies in your Presence generate that Charge instead

entries.name: Martial Weapons
entries.description_html: Martial Weapons can be used to Attack. Axes, Bows, Claws, Crossbows, Daggers, Flails, Maces, Quarterstaves, Spears, Swords, and Talismans are Martial Weapons.
entries.description_plain: Martial Weapons can be used to Attack. Axes, Bows, Claws, Crossbows, Daggers, Flails, Maces, Quarterstaves, Spears, Swords, and Talismans are Martial Weapons.

entries.name: Sacrifice
entries.description_html: Sacrificing is loss of a resource (commonly Life, Mana or Energy Shield) that does not count as taking damage. You cannot Sacrifice a resource you do not have. Sacrificing Life cannot reduce you below 1 Life, but Sacrifices you cause on others (such as Sacrificing Minion Life) can lead to their death.
entries.description_plain: Sacrificing is loss of a resource (commonly Life, Mana or Energy Shield) that does not count as taking damage. You cannot Sacrifice a resource you do not have. Sacrificing Life cannot reduce you below 1 Life, but Sacrifices you cause on others (such as Sacrificing Minion Life) can lead to their death.

entries.name: Travel Skills
entries.description_html: Travel Skills cover a large amount of distance without needing to target an enemy. If you have multiple Travel Skills with cooldowns, their cooldowns are shared.
entries.description_plain: Travel Skills cover a large amount of distance without needing to target an enemy. If you have multiple Travel Skills with cooldowns, their cooldowns are shared.

entries.name: Eternal Youth
entries.description_html:
Life Recharges instead of Energy Shield
Life Recovery from Flasks applies to Energy Shield instead
entries.description_plain: Life Recharges instead of Energy Shield Life Recovery from Flasks applies to Energy Shield instead

entries.name: Support Gem Requirements
entries.description_html:
Every Support Gem you have socketed will incur a cumulative Attribute requirement, generally at a value of five of the relevant stat for each support gem used.

This Attribute requirement is separate from that required by your Skill Gems and Equipment.
entries.description_plain: Every Support Gem you have socketed will incur a cumulative Attribute requirement, generally at a value of five of the relevant stat for each support gem used. This Attribute requirement is separate from that required by your Skill Gems and Equipment.

entries.name: Buff/Debuff Magnitude
entries.description_html:
The Magnitudes of a Buff or Debuff are the values of the stats it applies to the target. A Buff or Debuff with higher magnitudes is more powerful.

Modifiers to the Magnitude of Buffs or Debuffs come from whoever applies it and are multiplicative with modifiers to the Effect the Buff or Debuff has on the target.
entries.description_plain: The Magnitudes of a Buff or Debuff are the values of the stats it applies to the target. A Buff or Debuff with higher magnitudes is more powerful. Modifiers to the Magnitude of Buffs or Debuffs come from whoever applies it and are multiplicative with modifiers to the Effect the Buff or Debuff has on the target.

entries.name: Buff/Debuff Effect
entries.description_html: Modifiers to the Effect of Buffs or Debuffs usually come from the target it affects and are multiplicative with modifiers to the Magnitudes of the Buff or Debuff, which come from its creator.
entries.description_plain: Modifiers to the Effect of Buffs or Debuffs usually come from the target it affects and are multiplicative with modifiers to the Magnitudes of the Buff or Debuff, which come from its creator.

entries.name: Heartstopper
entries.description_html:
Take 50% less damage over time if you've started taking damage over time in the past second
Take 50% more damage over time if you haven't started taking damage over time in the past second
entries.description_plain: Take 50% less damage over time if you've started taking damage over time in the past second Take 50% more damage over time if you haven't started taking damage over time in the past second

entries.name: Elemental Equilibrium
entries.description_html:
Hits that deal Fire damage remove Fire Exposure and inflict Lightning Exposure
Hits that deal Cold damage remove Cold Exposure and inflict Fire Exposure
Hits that deal Lightning damage remove Lightning Exposure and inflict Cold Exposure
entries.description_plain: Hits that deal Fire damage remove Fire Exposure and inflict Lightning Exposure Hits that deal Cold damage remove Cold Exposure and inflict Fire Exposure Hits that deal Lightning damage remove Lightning Exposure and inflict Cold Exposure

entries.name: Oasis
entries.description_html:
Cannot use Charms
30% more Recovery from Flasks
entries.description_plain: Cannot use Charms 30% more Recovery from Flasks

entries.name: Arcane Surge
entries.description_html: Arcane Surge grants 15% increased Cast Speed and 20% more Mana Regeneration Rate.
entries.description_plain: Arcane Surge grants 15% increased Cast Speed and 20% more Mana Regeneration Rate.

entries.name: Arcane Surge
entries.description_html:
Arcane Surge grants 15% increased Cast Speed and 20% more Mana Regeneration Rate.
It lasts for 4 seconds by default.
entries.description_plain: Arcane Surge grants 15% increased Cast Speed and 20% more Mana Regeneration Rate. It lasts for 4 seconds by default.

entries.name: Invoke
entries.description_html: Invoked Skills are those Triggered by Invocation Skills.
entries.description_plain: Invoked Skills are those Triggered by Invocation Skills.

entries.name: Meta Gems
entries.description_html: Meta Gems are Skill Gems that can use, Trigger, or otherwise apply the effects of other Skill Gems. Skill Gems and Support Gems can be socketed into them interchangeably, though most Meta Gems require at least one Skill Gem to be socketed to function.
entries.description_plain: Meta Gems are Skill Gems that can use, Trigger, or otherwise apply the effects of other Skill Gems. Skill Gems and Support Gems can be socketed into them interchangeably, though most Meta Gems require at least one Skill Gem to be socketed to function.

entries.name: Final Strike
entries.description_html: Skills that meet this requirement use the term "Final Strike" to refer to the last hit of their combo. This includes basic Melee Attacks.
entries.description_plain: Skills that meet this requirement use the term "Final Strike" to refer to the last hit of their combo. This includes basic Melee Attacks.

entries.name: Corrupted Blood
entries.description_html:
Corrupted Blood is a Debuff that deals Physical damage over time and can stack up to 10 times.

Corrupted Blood is not Bleeding and is not affected by any stats related to Bleeding.
entries.description_plain: Corrupted Blood is a Debuff that deals Physical damage over time and can stack up to 10 times. Corrupted Blood is not Bleeding and is not affected by any stats related to Bleeding.

entries.name: Aggravated Bleeding
entries.description_html:
Bleeding that has been Aggravated always treats the target as moving, which causes it to deal 100% extra damage.

Once a Bleeding Debuff has been Aggravated, it will remain Aggravated until its duration expires.

Each Bleeding Debuff can be Aggravated, or not, independently one Bleeding Debuff being Aggravated does not mean other Bleeding Debuffs on the target are also Aggravated, and Aggravating some or all of them will have no effect on new Bleeding Debuffs applied afterwards. However, effects which Aggravate Bleeding on a target do so to all Bleeding Debuffs currently on that target unless otherwise specified.
entries.description_plain: Bleeding that has been Aggravated always treats the target as moving, which causes it to deal 100% extra damage. Once a Bleeding Debuff has been Aggravated, it will remain Aggravated until its duration expires. Each Bleeding Debuff can be Aggravated, or not, independently  one Bleeding Debuff being Aggravated does not mean other Bleeding Debuffs on the target are also Aggravated, and Aggravating some or all of them will have no effect on new Bleeding Debuffs applied afterwards. However, effects which Aggravate Bleeding on a target do so to all Bleeding Debuffs currently on that target unless otherwise specified.

entries.name: Aggravated Ignite
entries.description_html:
Ignite that has been Aggravated deals 100% extra damage.

Once an Ignite has been Aggravated, it will remain Aggravated until its duration expires.

Just like Bleeding, each Ignite Debuff can be Aggravated, or not, independently of others on the target.
entries.description_plain: Ignite that has been Aggravated deals 100% extra damage. Once an Ignite has been Aggravated, it will remain Aggravated until its duration expires. Just like Bleeding, each Ignite Debuff can be Aggravated, or not, independently of others on the target.

entries.name: Allies Leech the same amount
entries.description_html: Their modifier to the amount they leech will not affect this amount; your modifiers have already applied to it.
entries.description_plain: Their modifier to the amount they leech will not affect this amount; your modifiers have already applied to it.

entries.name: Non-Stacking Effects
entries.description_html: This effect does not stack. Applying it again before the first expires will refresh the duration.
entries.description_plain: This effect does not stack. Applying it again before the first expires will refresh the duration.

entries.name: Mark
entries.description_html: Marks are a family of Debuffs that apply powerful effects to a single enemy, usually for a limited duration. You can have multiple Marked enemies at once, but each individual enemy can only have a single Mark applied to them at once.
entries.description_plain: Marks are a family of Debuffs that apply powerful effects to a single enemy, usually for a limited duration. You can have multiple Marked enemies at once, but each individual enemy can only have a single Mark applied to them at once.

entries.name: Life Recharge
entries.description_html:
Lost Life will start Recharging at a rate of 12.5% per second after a base delay of 4 seconds. Further loss of Life resets this delay, interrupting Recharge.
Modifiers to Energy Shield Recharge Rate or to how fast it starts will also apply to Life Recharge.
entries.description_plain: Lost Life will start Recharging at a rate of 12.5% per second after a base delay of 4 seconds. Further loss of Life resets this delay, interrupting Recharge. Modifiers to Energy Shield Recharge Rate or to how fast it starts will also apply to Life Recharge.

entries.name: Energy Shield Recharge
entries.description_html: Lost Energy Shield will start Recharging at a rate of 12.5% per second after a base delay of 4 seconds. Further loss of Energy Shield resets this delay, interrupting Recharge.
entries.description_plain: Lost Energy Shield will start Recharging at a rate of 12.5% per second after a base delay of 4 seconds. Further loss of Energy Shield resets this delay, interrupting Recharge.

entries.name: Energy Shield Protecting Mana
entries.description_html: Energy Shield will no longer protect you from Damage, unless that damage would be dealt to Mana.
entries.description_plain: Energy Shield will no longer protect you from Damage, unless that damage would be dealt to Mana.

entries.name: Onslaught
entries.description_html:
Onslaught grants 20% increased Skill Speed and 10% increased movement speed.
Unless specified, Onslaught lasts 4 seconds.
entries.description_plain: Onslaught grants 20% increased Skill Speed and 10% increased movement speed. Unless specified, Onslaught lasts 4 seconds.

entries.name: Checkpoints
entries.description_html:
Checkpoints are a form of saving your progress through Wraeclast and will often appear before Boss fights and at points of interest. Reaching a Checkpoint will refill your Life, Mana, Flasks and Charms.

On death, you can choose to revive either in Town or at the last Checkpoint you reached. For this purpose, Waypoints also function as Checkpoints.
entries.description_plain: Checkpoints are a form of saving your progress through Wraeclast and will often appear before Boss fights and at points of interest. Reaching a Checkpoint will refill your Life, Mana, Flasks and Charms. On death, you can choose to revive either in Town or at the last Checkpoint you reached. For this purpose, Waypoints also function as Checkpoints.

entries.name: Waypoints
entries.description_html: Waypoints are a form of saving your progress through Wraeclast. Most areas (though not all) will have one, and they can be used to quickly travel from area to area. Reaching a Waypoint will refill your Life, Mana, Flasks and Charms.
entries.description_plain: Waypoints are a form of saving your progress through Wraeclast. Most areas (though not all) will have one, and they can be used to quickly travel from area to area. Reaching a Waypoint will refill your Life, Mana, Flasks and Charms.

entries.name: Elemental Ailment Threshold
entries.description_html: A higher Elemental Ailment Threshold makes it less likely that being Hit by Elemental Damage will apply the relevant Ailment, as well as lowering the amount of Freeze and Electrocute buildup recieved. A lower Elemental Ailment Threshold makes it more likely, and increases buildup of Freeze and Electrocute recieved. By default a player's Ailment Threshold is equal to half their Life.
entries.description_plain: A higher Elemental Ailment Threshold makes it less likely that being Hit by Elemental Damage will apply the relevant Ailment, as well as lowering the amount of Freeze and Electrocute buildup recieved. A lower Elemental Ailment Threshold makes it more likely, and increases buildup of Freeze and Electrocute recieved. By default a player's Ailment Threshold is equal to half their Life.

entries.name: Maximum Resistances
entries.description_html: The default maximum for Elemental or Chaos resistances is 75%. Maximum resistances cannot be raised above 90%.
entries.description_plain: The default maximum for Elemental or Chaos resistances is 75%. Maximum resistances cannot be raised above 90%.

entries.name: Resonance
entries.description_html:
Gain Power Charges instead of Frenzy Charges
Gain Frenzy Charges instead of Endurance Charges
Gain Endurance Charges instead of Power Charges
entries.description_plain: Gain Power Charges instead of Frenzy Charges Gain Frenzy Charges instead of Endurance Charges Gain Endurance Charges instead of Power Charges

entries.name: Sustained Skills
entries.description_html: Sustained skills cause a large number of Hits over a period of time. They roll for Critical Hits independently each time they damage enemies, rather than rolling once for the entire skill as other skills do.
entries.description_plain: Sustained skills cause a large number of Hits over a period of time. They roll for Critical Hits independently each time they damage enemies, rather than rolling once for the entire skill as other skills do.

entries.name: Daze
entries.description_html:
Some skills and effects have a chance to apply Daze to enemies on Hit.

Daze lasts for 8 seconds, and a Dazed enemy will take 50% more Stun Buildup. There are also a number of Skills, Effects, and other mechanics which interact with Daze for various benefits.
entries.description_plain: Some skills and effects have a chance to apply Daze to enemies on Hit. Daze lasts for 8 seconds, and a Dazed enemy will take 50% more Stun Buildup. There are also a number of Skills, Effects, and other mechanics which interact with Daze for various benefits.

entries.name: Combo
entries.description_html:
Some skills and effects require a certain Combo count to use. Combo is built by successfully Striking Enemies. Combo count will fall off after a short duration of not building or maintaining further Combo.

Combo can only be built while using the same weapon as the Combo Skill is bound to, and will be lost if you swap weapons.
entries.description_plain: Some skills and effects require a certain Combo count to use. Combo is built by successfully Striking Enemies. Combo count will fall off after a short duration of not building or maintaining further Combo. Combo can only be built while using the same weapon as the Combo Skill is bound to, and will be lost if you swap weapons.

entries.name: Minion Death and Killing Minions
entries.description_html: Minions whose durations expire or that are despawned by the player are considered to have died. However, effects that state they trigger when a Minion is Killed do not trigger in these cases. Minions are only Killed if they reach 0 life, though this can be caused by their summoner as well as enemies.
entries.description_plain: Minions whose durations expire or that are despawned by the player are considered to have died. However, effects that state they trigger when a Minion is Killed do not trigger in these cases. Minions are only Killed if they reach 0 life, though this can be caused by their summoner as well as enemies.

entries.name: Surrounded
entries.description_html: You are surrounded if there are at least 5 Enemies within 3 metres of you.
entries.description_plain: You are surrounded if there are at least 5 Enemies within 3 metres of you.

entries.name: Reservation
entries.description_html: Reservation effects prevent a portion of a given resource usually Spirit, though it can also be Life or Mana from being used for other purposes while active. Reserving a resource does not change the maximum value of that resource.
entries.description_plain: Reservation effects prevent a portion of a given resource  usually Spirit, though it can also be Life or Mana  from being used for other purposes while active. Reserving a resource does not change the maximum value of that resource.

entries.name: Low Infernal Flame
entries.description_html: You are on Low Infernal Flame if you have 35% of your maximum Infernal Flame or less.
entries.description_plain: You are on Low Infernal Flame if you have 35% of your maximum Infernal Flame or less.

entries.name: Bulwark
entries.description_html:
Dodge Roll cannot Avoid Damage
Take 30% less Damage from Hits while Dodge Rolling
entries.description_plain: Dodge Roll cannot Avoid Damage Take 30% less Damage from Hits while Dodge Rolling

entries.name: Damage Conversion
entries.description_html:
Damage can be converted from one type to another. This causes it to deal the new damage type, scale with modifiers to the new damage type, and no longer scale with modifiers to the old damage type.

For example, Fire damage converted to Lightning now scales with Lightning damage modifiers and causes Shock, but no longer scales with Fire damage modifiers or causes Ignite.

Conversion is a two step process. Conversion inherent to Skills occurs first, then Conversion from all other sources. Damage over time cannot be converted.
entries.description_plain: Damage can be converted from one type to another. This causes it to deal the new damage type, scale with modifiers to the new damage type, and no longer scale with modifiers to the old damage type. For example, Fire damage converted to Lightning now scales with Lightning damage modifiers and causes Shock, but no longer scales with Fire damage modifiers or causes Ignite. Conversion is a two step process. Conversion inherent to Skills occurs first, then Conversion from all other sources. Damage over time cannot be converted.

entries.name: Damage Gained as extra X
entries.description_html:
Damage gained as a specific damage type only scales with modifiers to the new type, not with modifiers to the source damage's type (unless they're the same type).

For example, Lightning damage gained from Physical damage scales with Lightning damage modifiers, but not Physical damage modifiers.

Damage Gain occurs in the same two step process as Damage Conversion. Damage over time cannot benefit from damage Gain.
entries.description_plain: Damage gained as a specific damage type only scales with modifiers to the new type, not with modifiers to the source damage's type (unless they're the same type). For example, Lightning damage gained from Physical damage scales with Lightning damage modifiers, but not Physical damage modifiers. Damage Gain occurs in the same two step process as Damage Conversion. Damage over time cannot benefit from damage Gain.

entries.name: Tailwind
entries.description_html: Tailwind is a stacking Buff which grants 1% increased movement speed, 3% increased Skill Speed and 15% increased Evasion Rating per stack for 10 seconds, refreshing whenever you gain another stack. Maximum 10 stacks.
entries.description_plain: Tailwind is a stacking Buff which grants 1% increased movement speed, 3% increased Skill Speed and 15% increased Evasion Rating per stack for 10 seconds, refreshing whenever you gain another stack. Maximum 10 stacks.

entries.name: Jade
entries.description_html: Jade is a stacking Buff which grants 1% additional Physical Damage Reduction per stack. Maximum of 10 Jade stacks.
entries.description_plain: Jade is a stacking Buff which grants 1% additional Physical Damage Reduction per stack. Maximum of 10 Jade stacks.

entries.name: Concentration
entries.description_html: Enemies have less Cooldown Recovery Rate the lower their Concentration, scaling down to 50% less Cooldown Recovery Rate when Concentration is 0%.
entries.description_plain: Enemies have less Cooldown Recovery Rate the lower their Concentration, scaling down to 50% less Cooldown Recovery Rate when Concentration is 0%.

entries.name: Flame of Chayula
entries.description_html:
Collecting Flames of Chayula grants the following bonuses:
Red Flames of Chayula Leech 7% of your maximum Life to you
Blue Flames of Chayula Leech 7% of your maximum Mana to you
Purple Flames of Chayula provide a stacking Buff granting 7% of damage as extra Chaos damage for 5 seconds, and stacks up to 10 times. Flames of Chayula count as Remnants.
entries.description_plain: Collecting Flames of Chayula grants the following bonuses: Red Flames of Chayula Leech 7% of your maximum Life to you Blue Flames of Chayula Leech 7% of your maximum Mana to you Purple Flames of Chayula provide a stacking Buff granting 7% of damage as extra Chaos damage for 5 seconds, and stacks up to 10 times. Flames of Chayula count as Remnants.

entries.name: Red Flames of Chayula
entries.description_html: Red Flames of Chayula Leech 7% of your maximum Life to you to when collected.
entries.description_plain: Red Flames of Chayula Leech 7% of your maximum Life to you to when collected.

entries.name: Blue Flames of Chayula
entries.description_html: Blue Flames of Chayula Leech 7% of your maximum Mana to you when collected.
entries.description_plain: Blue Flames of Chayula Leech 7% of your maximum Mana to you when collected.

entries.name: Small Passives
entries.description_html: Small Passive Skills are Passives that are not Notables, Keystones, Ascendancy Passive Skills or Passive Skills where you can select an Attribute.
entries.description_plain: Small Passive Skills are Passives that are not Notables, Keystones, Ascendancy Passive Skills or Passive Skills where you can select an Attribute.

entries.name: Valour
entries.description_html:
Valour is used to fuel Banner Skills. Killing an enemy with an Attack generates 1 Valour, and Banners passively gain 1 Valour per second while a Unique enemy is in your Presence. You can only gain Valour once every 0.5 seconds, and a Banner skill cannot gain Valour while its Banner is placed.

Each Banner has 50 maximum Valour by default. If you have multiple Banner skills active, each gains Valour separately.
entries.description_plain: Valour is used to fuel Banner Skills. Killing an enemy with an Attack generates 1 Valour, and Banners passively gain 1 Valour per second while a Unique enemy is in your Presence. You can only gain Valour once every 0.5 seconds, and a Banner skill cannot gain Valour while its Banner is placed. Each Banner has 50 maximum Valour by default. If you have multiple Banner skills active, each gains Valour separately.

entries.name: Intimidate
entries.description_html: Intimidate is a Debuff that inflicts 10% increased damage taken and 10% reduced damage dealt.
entries.description_plain: Intimidate is a Debuff that inflicts 10% increased damage taken and 10% reduced damage dealt.

entries.name: Ballista Totems
entries.description_html: Ballistas are a type of Totem that use Projectile Attacks.
entries.description_plain: Ballistas are a type of Totem that use Projectile Attacks.

entries.name: Soul Core
entries.description_html: Soul Cores are Vaalish artifacts that work in the same manner as Runes, but have unusual effects.
entries.description_plain: Soul Cores are Vaalish artifacts that work in the same manner as Runes, but have unusual effects.

entries.name: Honour
entries.description_html: Honour is an additional resource you have to manage within the Trial of the Sekhemas. A percentage of the damage you take from enemies in the Trial will be taken from your Honour. If your Honour reaches zero then the Trial is failed.
entries.description_plain: Honour is an additional resource you have to manage within the Trial of the Sekhemas. A percentage of the damage you take from enemies in the Trial will be taken from your Honour. If your Honour reaches zero then the Trial is failed.

entries.name: Lightning Ailments
entries.description_html: Shock and Electrocute are Lightning Ailments.
entries.description_plain: Shock and Electrocute are Lightning Ailments.

entries.name: Added Skill Use Time
entries.description_html: This additional use time is fixed and will not be modified by skill use speed stats.
entries.description_plain: This additional use time is fixed and will not be modified by skill use speed stats.

entries.name: Covered in Oil
entries.description_html:
Enemies covered in Oil have their movement speed Slowed, are inflicted with Fire Exposure and have 200% more Magnitude of Flammability inflicted on them.

Ignited Ground or Detonator Skills will Ignite Oil-covered enemies. This removes the Oil, but the Exposure will remain for the duration of that Ignite.
entries.description_plain: Enemies covered in Oil have their movement speed Slowed, are inflicted with Fire Exposure and have 200% more Magnitude of Flammability inflicted on them. Ignited Ground or Detonator Skills will Ignite Oil-covered enemies. This removes the Oil, but the Exposure will remain for the duration of that Ignite.

entries.name: Oil Ground
entries.description_html:
Enemies standing in Oil Ground have their movement speed Slowed and are inflicted with Exposure.

Ignited enemies, Ignited Ground, or Detonator Skills that touch the Oil cause it to catch fire, Igniting enemies instead of Slowing them, but still inflicting the Exposure.
entries.description_plain: Enemies standing in Oil Ground have their movement speed Slowed and are inflicted with Exposure. Ignited enemies, Ignited Ground, or Detonator Skills that touch the Oil cause it to catch fire, Igniting enemies instead of Slowing them, but still inflicting the Exposure.

entries.name: Stat Totals
entries.description_html: The Total value of a stat is the value after all calculations have been performed. Modifiers to the Total value apply after all other modifiers.
entries.description_plain: The Total value of a stat is the value after all calculations have been performed. Modifiers to the Total value apply after all other modifiers.

entries.name: Adding to Stat Totals
entries.description_html: Adding to the Total value of a stat occurs after all other calculations have been performed. This means that the added value does not benefit from percentage modifiers to the stat.
entries.description_plain: Adding to the Total value of a stat occurs after all other calculations have been performed. This means that the added value does not benefit from percentage modifiers to the stat.

entries.name: Charms
entries.description_html:
Charms are protective trinkets you can equip that automatically trigger a defensive effect when a specific condition is met. Similar to Flasks, Charms require charges to trigger. Charm charges can be regained by killing monsters, granting charges equal to half of the monster's Power. Checkpoints and Wells completely recharge Charms when activated.

The maximum number of Charm slots is capped at 3.
entries.description_plain: Charms are protective trinkets you can equip that automatically trigger a defensive effect when a specific condition is met. Similar to Flasks, Charms require charges to trigger. Charm charges can be regained by killing monsters, granting charges equal to half of the monster's Power. Checkpoints and Wells completely recharge Charms when activated. The maximum number of Charm slots is capped at 3.

entries.name: Zealot's Oath
entries.description_html:
Excess Life Recovery from Regeneration is applied to Energy Shield.
Energy Shield does not Recharge.
entries.description_plain: Excess Life Recovery from Regeneration is applied to Energy Shield. Energy Shield does not Recharge.

entries.name: Unbound Fury
entries.description_html: Chilling Enemies grants 1 Unbound Fury, Shocking or Igniting Enemies grants 2 Unbound Fury and Freezing or Electrocuting Enemies grants 6 Unbound Fury.
entries.description_plain: Chilling Enemies grants 1 Unbound Fury, Shocking or Igniting Enemies grants 2 Unbound Fury and Freezing or Electrocuting Enemies grants 6 Unbound Fury.

entries.name: Stat Conversion
entries.description_html:
Converting stat A to stat B applies the base value of stat A to stat B instead. The converted stat scales with percentage modifiers to stat B, but not with percentage modifiers to stat A.

For example, if you converted your Evasion to Armour, the converted portion would be scaled by percentage modifiers to Armour, but percentage modifiers to Evasion would have no effect.
entries.description_plain: Converting stat A to stat B applies the base value of stat A to stat B instead. The converted stat scales with percentage modifiers to stat B, but not with percentage modifiers to stat A. For example, if you converted your Evasion to Armour, the converted portion would be scaled by percentage modifiers to Armour, but percentage modifiers to Evasion would have no effect.

entries.name: Life Loss
entries.description_html: Life Loss is not damage, and can't be mitigated or absorbed by Energy Shield. Life Loss can still kill you.
entries.description_plain: Life Loss is not damage, and can't be mitigated or absorbed by Energy Shield. Life Loss can still kill you.

entries.name: Gaining Stats from other Stats
entries.description_html:
Gaining a percentage of stat A as stat B is calculated from the base value of stat A. The portion gained scales with percentage modifiers to stat B, but not with percentage modifiers to stat A.

For example, if you gained 50% of Evasion as Armour, the portion gained would be scaled by percentage modifiers to Armour, but not by percentage modifiers to Evasion.
entries.description_plain: Gaining a percentage of stat A as stat B is calculated from the base value of stat A. The portion gained scales with percentage modifiers to stat B, but not with percentage modifiers to stat A. For example, if you gained 50% of Evasion as Armour, the portion gained would be scaled by percentage modifiers to Armour, but not by percentage modifiers to Evasion.

entries.name: Overflow
entries.description_html: Recovery which Overflows its maximum can be recovered up to 1.5 times that maximum.
entries.description_plain: Recovery which Overflows its maximum can be recovered up to 1.5 times that maximum.

entries.name: Minion Commands
entries.description_html: Some Minions can be Commanded to perform certain actions. This requires you to use the corresponding Command skill, which will cause one of your Minions to carry out the Command.
entries.description_plain: Some Minions can be Commanded to perform certain actions. This requires you to use the corresponding Command skill, which will cause one of your Minions to carry out the Command.

entries.name: Difficulty
entries.description_html:
Difficulty causes monsters to have increased damage and life, as well as improving the items they drop.

Certain Bosses with increased difficulty will gain new abilities and begin to drop exclusive items, and have a reduced number of Respawn Attempts.

Difficulty above 4 has no additional effect.
entries.description_plain: Difficulty causes monsters to have increased damage and life, as well as improving the items they drop. Certain Bosses with increased difficulty will gain new abilities and begin to drop exclusive items, and have a reduced number of Respawn Attempts. Difficulty above 4 has no additional effect.

entries.name: Revival Availability
entries.description_html:
Most endgame content allows for a limited number of deaths before you can no longer access the area. Most areas allow unlimited leaving and re-entry for other reasons except while fighting a boss.

On death during a boss fight, the Map Owner may respawn all players into a new instance of the area to attempt the boss fight again.

The number of modifiers on a Waystone will reduce the number of Revivals available allowed when opening a Map. For pinnacle endgame content, increased Difficulty will reduce the number of Revivals available.
entries.description_plain: Most endgame content allows for a limited number of deaths before you can no longer access the area. Most areas allow unlimited leaving and re-entry for other reasons except while fighting a boss. On death during a boss fight, the Map Owner may respawn all players into a new instance of the area to attempt the boss fight again. The number of modifiers on a Waystone will reduce the number of Revivals available allowed when opening a Map. For pinnacle endgame content, increased Difficulty will reduce the number of Revivals available.

entries.name: Map Boss
entries.description_html:
Maps will occasionally contain a Map Boss. These Map Bosses are extremely powerful monsters that have special mechanics and drop greatly increased rewards.

Map Bosses frequently drop Maps one Tier higher.
entries.description_plain: Maps will occasionally contain a Map Boss. These Map Bosses are extremely powerful monsters that have special mechanics and drop greatly increased rewards. Map Bosses frequently drop Maps one Tier higher.

entries.name: Waking Nightmare
entries.description_html: This Debuff causes you take 10% increased damage and have 10% reduced Light Radius for 10 seconds per stack.
entries.description_plain: This Debuff causes you take 10% increased damage and have 10% reduced Light Radius for 10 seconds per stack.

entries.name: Toughness
entries.description_html: The higher toughness a monster has, the less damage it takes. A monster with 100% increased Toughness takes 50% less damage, a monster with 200% increased toughness takes 67% less damage, and so on. Reduced toughness causes monsters to take more damage.
entries.description_plain: The higher toughness a monster has, the less damage it takes. A monster with 100% increased Toughness takes 50% less damage, a monster with 200% increased toughness takes 67% less damage, and so on. Reduced toughness causes monsters to take more damage.

entries.name: Spreading Ailments
entries.description_html: Spreading an ailment inflicts a new, matching ailment on another target, from the same source. The new ailment can potentially spread further, but never back to the same target twice.
entries.description_plain: Spreading an ailment inflicts a new, matching ailment on another target, from the same source. The new ailment can potentially spread further, but never back to the same target twice.

entries.name: Dance with Death
entries.description_html: 25% more Skill Speed while Off Hand is empty and you have a One-Handed Martial Weapon equipped in your Main Hand.
entries.description_plain: 25% more Skill Speed while Off Hand is empty and you have a One-Handed Martial Weapon equipped in your Main Hand.

entries.name: Damage Contributing to Ailments
entries.description_html:
By default, specific Ailments are calculated based on only specific damage types, such as only the Fire damage of a Hit mattering when inflicting Ignite.

Allowing another damage type to contribute to an Ailment means that all damage of the relevant types is summed when performing calculations for that Ailment.

For Ailments that use Hit damage to determine Ailment chance or buildup, this means that the damage type becomes capable of inflicting that Ailment. For Ailments that only use Hit damage to determine Ailment Magnitude (i.e. Bleeding and Poison), you still need a way to apply those Ailments (e.g. a source of Bleeding or Poison chance).
entries.description_plain: By default, specific Ailments are calculated based on only specific damage types, such as only the Fire damage of a Hit mattering when inflicting Ignite. Allowing another damage type to contribute to an Ailment means that all damage of the relevant types is summed when performing calculations for that Ailment. For Ailments that use Hit damage to determine Ailment chance or buildup, this means that the damage type becomes capable of inflicting that Ailment. For Ailments that only use Hit damage to determine Ailment Magnitude (i.e. Bleeding and Poison), you still need a way to apply those Ailments (e.g. a source of Bleeding or Poison chance).

entries.name: Weapon Set Passive Skill Points
entries.description_html: Weapon Set Passive Skill Points can be allocated differently in each of your Weapon Set Passive Trees, including your default Passive Tree.
entries.description_plain: Weapon Set Passive Skill Points can be allocated differently in each of your Weapon Set Passive Trees, including your default Passive Tree.

entries.name: Runic Inscriptions
entries.description_html: Certain Skills which create Areas of Effect on the ground create Runic Inscriptions when doing so. Various effects such as Support Gems and Unique Items can interact with these Inscriptions to cause many different effects.
entries.description_plain: Certain Skills which create Areas of Effect on the ground create Runic Inscriptions when doing so. Various effects such as Support Gems and Unique Items can interact with these Inscriptions to cause many different effects.

entries.name: Offering Skills
entries.description_html: Offering Skills target an active Skeleton Minion to create an Offering Spike. Offering Spikes grant various Buffs to you or your Minions, and can even directly damage Enemies. Offering Skills are themselves damageable Minions and their Buffs are lost if they die.
entries.description_plain: Offering Skills target an active Skeleton Minion to create an Offering Spike. Offering Spikes grant various Buffs to you or your Minions, and can even directly damage Enemies. Offering Skills are themselves damageable Minions and their Buffs are lost if they die.

entries.name: Payoff Skills
entries.description_html: Payoff Skills have powerful extra affects when Hitting enemies inflicted with specific Debuffs, often Consuming the Debuff in the process. Payoff Skills cannot inflict the Debuff they interact with.
entries.description_plain: Payoff Skills have powerful extra affects when Hitting enemies inflicted with specific Debuffs, often Consuming the Debuff in the process. Payoff Skills cannot inflict the Debuff they interact with.

entries.name: Grenade Skills
entries.description_html:
Grenade Skills are only usable when wielding a Crossbow. They have cooldowns, but generally deliver high damage or powerful utility.

Grenade Skills have a fuse duration and will generally not explode until the fuse has expired, so they are strongest when you aim carefully and predict enemy movements.

Grenades cannot Fork or Chain.
entries.description_plain: Grenade Skills are only usable when wielding a Crossbow. They have cooldowns, but generally deliver high damage or powerful utility. Grenade Skills have a fuse duration and will generally not explode until the fuse has expired, so they are strongest when you aim carefully and predict enemy movements. Grenades cannot Fork or Chain.

entries.name: Stun Recovery
entries.description_html: Increasing your Stun Recovery causes you to recover more quickly from being Stunned.
entries.description_plain: Increasing your Stun Recovery causes you to recover more quickly from being Stunned.

entries.name: Grasping Vines
entries.description_html:
Grasping Vines is a stacking Debuff that Slows character movement speed by 8% for each stack applied.
Moving will gradually remove stacks of Grasping Vines.
entries.description_plain: Grasping Vines is a stacking Debuff that Slows character movement speed by 8% for each stack applied. Moving will gradually remove stacks of Grasping Vines.

entries.name: Enraged
entries.description_html: Enraged is a Buff that grants 25% Toughness and 25% increased damage.
entries.description_plain: Enraged is a Buff that grants 25% Toughness and 25% increased damage.

entries.name: Volatiles
entries.description_html: Volatiles are homing orbs which move towards a target before exploding after a duration or when they get close enough, dealing damage in a larger area.
entries.description_plain: Volatiles are homing orbs which move towards a target before exploding after a duration or when they get close enough, dealing damage in a larger area.

entries.name: Petrify
entries.description_html: Petrify is a Debuff which causes targets to become covered in stone and unable to move or act.
entries.description_plain: Petrify is a Debuff which causes targets to become covered in stone and unable to move or act.

entries.name: Runes
entries.description_html: Runes can be socketed into Weapons or Armours with a Rune Socket to add an additional modifier to the item, as listed on the Rune. Once socketed, a Rune cannot be removed.
entries.description_plain: Runes can be socketed into Weapons or Armours with a Rune Socket to add an additional modifier to the item, as listed on the Rune. Once socketed, a Rune cannot be removed.

entries.name: Black Scythe Training
entries.description_html:
Gain no inherent bonus from Strength
1% increased Energy Shield per 2 Strength
entries.description_plain: Gain no inherent bonus from Strength 1% increased Energy Shield per 2 Strength

entries.name: Circular Teachings
entries.description_html:
Gain no inherent bonus from Dexterity
1% increased Armour per 2 Dexterity
entries.description_plain: Gain no inherent bonus from Dexterity 1% increased Armour per 2 Dexterity

entries.name: Knightly Tenets
entries.description_html:
Gain no inherent bonus from Intelligence
1% increased Evasion Rating per 2 Intelligence
entries.description_plain: Gain no inherent bonus from Intelligence 1% increased Evasion Rating per 2 Intelligence

entries.name: Sacred Water
entries.description_html: Sacred Water is a resource you find within the Trial of the Sekhemas. It is used to purchase Boons from merchants and venerate Maraketh Shrines, granting you various effects within the Trial.
entries.description_plain: Sacred Water is a resource you find within the Trial of the Sekhemas. It is used to purchase Boons from merchants and venerate Maraketh Shrines, granting you various effects within the Trial.

entries.name: Boons
entries.description_html:
Boons are positive effects that are applied to the Trial of the Sekhemas; making them easier to run.
Boons can be gained from certain Maraketh Shrines or from buying them from the Trial Merchant using Sacred Water.
Boons can be either Minor or Major, providing varying benefits to your Trial.
entries.description_plain: Boons are positive effects that are applied to the Trial of the Sekhemas; making them easier to run. Boons can be gained from certain Maraketh Shrines or from buying them from the Trial Merchant using Sacred Water. Boons can be either Minor or Major, providing varying benefits to your Trial.

entries.name: Afflictions
entries.description_html:
Afflictions are negative effects that are applied to the Trial of the Sekhemas; making them harder to run.
Afflictions will be applied for entering certain rooms in the Trial or from encountering certain Maraketh Shrines.
Afflictions can be either Minor or Major, providing varying negative effects to your Trial.
entries.description_plain: Afflictions are negative effects that are applied to the Trial of the Sekhemas; making them harder to run. Afflictions will be applied for entering certain rooms in the Trial or from encountering certain Maraketh Shrines. Afflictions can be either Minor or Major, providing varying negative effects to your Trial.

entries.name: Enfeeble
entries.description_html: Enfeeble is a Curse that lessens the damage dealt by those affected. If not otherwise specified, Enfeeble lessens damage dealt by unique targets by 10%, and other targets by 20%.
entries.description_plain: Enfeeble is a Curse that lessens the damage dealt by those affected. If not otherwise specified, Enfeeble lessens damage dealt by unique targets by 10%, and other targets by 20%.

entries.name: Binding Chains
entries.description_html: Binding Chains is a stacking Debuff that Slows character movement speed by 8% for each stack applied.
entries.description_plain: Binding Chains is a stacking Debuff that Slows character movement speed by 8% for each stack applied.

entries.name: Trial of the Sekhema Keys
entries.description_html: Bronze, Silver or Gold Keys are sometimes awarded for completing rooms or for killing monsters within the Trial of the Sekhemas. After completing each floor of the Trial there will be an assortment of Bronze, Silver and Gold caches which can be opened by their respective key, revealing treasures within.
entries.description_plain: Bronze, Silver or Gold Keys are sometimes awarded for completing rooms or for killing monsters within the Trial of the Sekhemas. After completing each floor of the Trial there will be an assortment of Bronze, Silver and Gold caches which can be opened by their respective key, revealing treasures within.

entries.name: Relics
entries.description_html:
Relics are items that are placed in the Relic Altar before the start of the Trial of the Sekhemas.
Relics influence various aspects of the Trial to make it easier. Your Relics persist between Trials.
Selected Relics cannot be changed while you have an active Trial.
Relics have varying dimensions, so arrange them carefully to maximise your benefits.
You can unlock more Relic slots by killing bosses deeper into the Trials.
Spare Relics can be stored in the Relic Locker or any of your personal stash tabs.

You can unlock more Relic slots by killing bosses deeper into the Trials. Spare Relics can be stored in the Relic Locker or any of your personal stash tabs.

entries.name: Slow Magnitude Modifier
entries.description_html: This is modifier applies to Debuffs you inflict that Slow enemies, and scales only the specific Magnitude that slows the target. It will not affect any other Magnitudes that Debuff has if it does other things in addition to the Slow.
entries.description_plain: This is modifier applies to Debuffs you inflict that Slow enemies, and scales only the specific Magnitude that slows the target. It will not affect any other Magnitudes that Debuff has if it does other things in addition to the Slow.

entries.name: High Infernal Flame
entries.description_html: You are on High Infernal Flame if you have 65% of your maximum Infernal Flame or more.
entries.description_plain: You are on High Infernal Flame if you have 65% of your maximum Infernal Flame or more.

entries.name: Purple Flame of Chayula
entries.description_html: Purple Flames of Chayula provide a stacking Buff granting 7% of damage as extra Chaos damage. Stacks up to 10 times.
entries.description_plain: Purple Flames of Chayula provide a stacking Buff granting 7% of damage as extra Chaos damage. Stacks up to 10 times.

entries.name: Skill Speed
entries.description_html: Affects the speed at which all Skills are used. Increases and reductions to Skill Speed stack additively with increases and reductions to Attack Speed, Cast Speed, Warcry Speed, and similar stats.
entries.description_plain: Affects the speed at which all Skills are used. Increases and reductions to Skill Speed stack additively with increases and reductions to Attack Speed, Cast Speed, Warcry Speed, and similar stats.

entries.name: Wildwood Wisp
entries.description_html: Wildwood Wisps grant 50% increased Tribute Gained to Players within 3 metres of it.
entries.description_plain: Wildwood Wisps grant 50% increased Tribute Gained to Players within 3 metres of it.

entries.name: Close Range
entries.description_html: Close Range is anywhere within 2 metres of your character. Normally, Melee Attacks you make are in Close Range.
entries.description_plain: Close Range is anywhere within 2 metres of your character. Normally, Melee Attacks you make are in Close Range.

entries.name: Unleash
entries.description_html: Unleash is an effect that allows Spells to accumulate Seals that allows the Spell to reoccur when being cast. There is a limit of 2 Seals per Spell.
entries.description_plain: Unleash is an effect that allows Spells to accumulate Seals that allows the Spell to reoccur when being cast. There is a limit of 2 Seals per Spell.

entries.name: Link Skills
entries.description_html: Link Skills are Skills that allow you to link to your Allies to provide them with Buffs while you are within a certain distance of them.
entries.description_plain: Link Skills are Skills that allow you to link to your Allies to provide them with Buffs while you are within a certain distance of them.

entries.name: Guard
entries.description_html:
Guard is a Buff that provides a buffer against damage from Hits, taking the damage before your Life or Energy Shield until the buff expires or is depleted.

You can only have a single Guard buff at a time. If you gain Guard when you already have it, whichever buff has the higher magnitude will be kept, and that buff's duration will be refreshed by an amount proportional to the magnitude of the discarded buff, but not to longer than its original duration.
entries.description_plain: Guard is a Buff that provides a buffer against damage from Hits, taking the damage before your Life or Energy Shield until the buff expires or is depleted. You can only have a single Guard buff at a time. If you gain Guard when you already have it, whichever buff has the higher magnitude will be kept, and that buff's duration will be refreshed by an amount proportional to the magnitude of the discarded buff, but not to longer than its original duration.

entries.name: Deadly Map Boss
entries.description_html: Area contains a Deadly Map Boss.
entries.description_plain: Area contains a Deadly Map Boss.

entries.name: Map Boss
entries.description_html: Area contains a Map Boss.
entries.description_plain: Area contains a Map Boss.

entries.name: Delirium
entries.description_html:
Maps containing a Delirium Mirror can have the mirror walked through to unleash the rolling Delirium fog ring across the current area.
You must stay within this fog as it expands to maintain the Delirium or it will dissapear.

Defeating any monster while in this fog adds to a rewards counter, with the culminated rewards being dropped after the fog dissapears.
Simulacrum Splinters can be collected from Delirium Monsters to form a Simulacrum that allows access to a challenging Delirium encounter via the Realmgate.

Maps instilled with Liquid Emotions will have constant Delirium Fog throughout the map, and not have any rewards that drop as Delirium fog does not dissapear in these maps.

entries.name: Expedition
entries.description_html:
Expeditions are Ancient Kalguuran burial sites, with hidden artifacts and dangers buried beneath the ground.
Help the Kalguuran Settlers set up a chain of explosives and unearth the treasures, but beware of the dangers that hide in wait.
Remnants can also be detonated to add modifiers to the rest of the Expedition encounter; making them harder but more rewarding.

Expedition monsters and chests will occasionally drop Artifacts that can be traded at the Kalguuran Settlers for items.
Vendor Refresh Currencies can also occasionally drop which allow for the refreshing of Kalguuran Settler shops.
entries.description_plain: Expeditions are Ancient Kalguuran burial sites, with hidden artifacts and dangers buried beneath the ground. Help the Kalguuran Settlers set up a chain of explosives and unearth the treasures, but beware of the dangers that hide in wait. Remnants can also be detonated to add modifiers to the rest of the Expedition encounter; making them harder but more rewarding. Expedition monsters and chests will occasionally drop Artifacts that can be traded at the Kalguuran Settlers for items. Vendor Refresh Currencies can also occasionally drop which allow for the refreshing of Kalguuran Settler shops.

entries.name: Breach
entries.description_html:
A Breach is a tear in the fabric of reality. Opening it will allow you to see and interact with monsters from another dimension.
The faster you can defeat these monsters, the longer you will keep the Breach open.

Breaches will sometimes have Clasped Hands, which drop items when walked over.
Breach Splinters can be collected from Clasped Hands and defeated Breach monsters to form a Breachstone that allows access to the Twisted Domain via the Realmgate.
entries.description_plain: A Breach is a tear in the fabric of reality. Opening it will allow you to see and interact with monsters from another dimension. The faster you can defeat these monsters, the longer you will keep the Breach open. Breaches will sometimes have Clasped Hands, which drop items when walked over. Breach Splinters can be collected from Clasped Hands and defeated Breach monsters to form a Breachstone that allows access to the Twisted Domain via the Realmgate.

entries.name: Ritual
entries.description_html:
Ritual Altars are sacrificial sites that absorb the monsters slain within their ritual circles. After an amount of monsters have been slain, the Ritual can be activated.
Activating the Ritual will resurrect the slain monsters, requiring you slay them once more.

Defeating these revived monsters earns you Tribute, a resource that you can trade for various Favours from the Ritual Altar.
The list of Favours tradable for Tribute can be rerolled, costing Tribute.
Favours can be deferred, paying a part of their cost but having them appear again later.

Activating the Ritual will resurrect the slain monsters, requiring you slay them once more. Defeating these revived monsters earns you Tribute, a resource that you can trade for various Favours from the Ritual Altar. The list of Favours tradable for Tribute can be rerolled, costing Tribute. Favours can be deferred, paying a part of their cost but having them appear again later.

entries.name: Irradiated
entries.description_html: Area has +1 to Monster Level.
entries.description_plain: Area has +1 to Monster Level.

entries.name: Abyss
entries.description_html:
An Abyss is a pit which leads deep underground with multiple fissures branching from it. Any monsters spawned near an Abyss will be weakened by it.
Defeating these weakened monsters will cause the fissures to close.
Once the fissures have closed all the way to the pit, the pit will activate and spawn a large number of Abyssal monsters.
The rarity of the monsters spawned depends on the rarity of the slain weakened monsters and the emerging Abyssal will steal some or all of the modifiers from them.
Any of the modifiers stolen by Rare Abyssal can be upgraded to Abyssal Modifiers.
There are three separate groups of Abyssal Monsters. The Lightless, the Blackblooded and the Legion of the Pit, each area generally contains one of these groups.
Rarely a stolen modifier can become a Lichborn Modifier.

Defeating all these monsters will close the pit. Each closed pit has a chance to spawn an Abyssal Trove which can grant pieces of Preserved Bone to craft onto your Items.

Sometimes when the Abyssal emerging from a pit is slain it will instead open an underground dungeon called an Abyssal Depths.
The Abyssal Depths contains many Abyssal monsters and all Rare monsters will have an Abyssal Modifier.
At the end of the Abyssal Depths is a more powerful Rare with both a Lichborn Modifier and an Abyssal Modifier. Defeating this Rare will unlock valuable chests nearby.

The chests at the end of the Abyssal Depths can also drop pieces of Preseved Bone, but also can rarely drop additional exclusive Omens and Lineage Supports.

At higher levels the Abyssal Depths can lead to powerful Boss Fights.
