entries.name: Precursor Tablets
entries.description_html: Precursor Tablets are special items that can be consumed by completed Precursor Towers to add more Endgame Mechanics to surrounding maps on your Atlas.
entries.description_plain: Precursor Tablets are special items that can be consumed by completed Precursor Towers to add more Endgame Mechanics to surrounding maps on your Atlas.

entries.name: Waystones
entries.description_html:
Waystones are items that can be used to travel to Maps on the Atlas.
Waystones come in different tiers, with higher tiers meaning higher level monsters to fight.
Waystones can be modified to increase the difficulty and reward of the monster encountered in maps.
entries.description_plain: Waystones are items that can be used to travel to Maps on the Atlas. Waystones come in different tiers, with higher tiers meaning higher level monsters to fight. Waystones can be modified to increase the difficulty and reward of the monster encountered in maps.

entries.name: Essence
entries.description_html:
Essence monsters are powerful monsters trapped in crystallised corruption.
Breaking these monsters free allows them to be defeated, dropping the Essence that can then be used to modify equipment.
entries.description_plain: Essence monsters are powerful monsters trapped in crystallised corruption. Breaking these monsters free allows them to be defeated, dropping the Essence that can then be used to modify equipment.

entries.name: Shrine
entries.description_html:
Shrines are Precursor Artifacts that empower monsters with its Presence with various effects.
Defeat all the monsters surrounding the Shrine and interact with it to temporarily gain the power for yourself.
entries.description_plain: Shrines are Precursor Artifacts that empower monsters with its Presence with various effects. Defeat all the monsters surrounding the Shrine and interact with it to temporarily gain the power for yourself.

entries.name: Strongbox
entries.description_html:
Strongboxes are locked chests that contain various items.
Attempting to unlock a Strongbox will unleash Packs of monsters that must be defeated in order to get the items within.
Strongboxes can be modified to increase the difficulty and reward of the monsters and rewards within respectively.
entries.description_plain: Strongboxes are locked chests that contain various items. Attempting to unlock a Strongbox will unleash Packs of monsters that must be defeated in order to get the items within. Strongboxes can be modified to increase the difficulty and reward of the monsters and rewards within respectively.

entries.name: Precursor Towers
entries.description_html:
Precursor Towers are ancient structures that are scattered all throughout the Atlas. Precursor Tower Maps can be completed to reveal a large area around them and allow for the use of a Precursor Tablet, modifying the Maps in an area around it.

Completing a Precursor Tower requires you to activate the Precursor Beacon.
entries.description_plain: Precursor Towers are ancient structures that are scattered all throughout the Atlas. Precursor Tower Maps can be completed to reveal a large area around them and allow for the use of a Precursor Tablet, modifying the Maps in an area around it. Completing a Precursor Tower requires you to activate the Precursor Beacon.

entries.name: Fracturing Mirrors
entries.description_html: Fracturing Mirrors are structures found in Delirium Fog that shatter when you get near them, spawning Delirium monsters.
entries.description_plain: Fracturing Mirrors are structures found in Delirium Fog that shatter when you get near them, spawning Delirium monsters.

entries.name: Acrobatics
entries.description_html:
Can Evade all Hits
75% less Evasion Rating
entries.description_plain: Can Evade all Hits 75% less Evasion Rating

entries.name: Basic Jewel
entries.description_html:
Basic Jewels do not affect nodes in a radius.
Basic Jewels are Rubies, Emeralds, Sapphires and Diamonds.
entries.description_plain: Basic Jewels do not affect nodes in a radius. Basic Jewels are Rubies, Emeralds, Sapphires and Diamonds.

entries.name: The Realmgate
entries.description_html: The Realmgate is a piece of Vaal Technology which allows the use of Atlas mechanic keys; accessing deadly areas and facing off against powerful enemies.
entries.description_plain: The Realmgate is a piece of Vaal Technology which allows the use of Atlas mechanic keys; accessing deadly areas and facing off against powerful enemies.

entries.name: The Reliquary Vault
entries.description_html: The Reliquary Vault is a Vaal Vault which can be accessed by using Reliquary Keys found throughout the Atlas.
entries.description_plain: The Reliquary Vault is a Vaal Vault which can be accessed by using Reliquary Keys found throughout the Atlas.

entries.name: Corruption
entries.description_html:
Contains Corruption, which may add an additional modifier to the area.

Corrupted Areas cause slain monsters to Coalesce Corruption to manifest powerful monsters.
entries.description_plain: Contains Corruption, which may add an additional modifier to the area. Corrupted Areas cause slain monsters to Coalesce Corruption to manifest powerful monsters.

entries.name: Unique Map
entries.description_html:
Contains a Unique Map layout which may contain specialised rewards.

Unique Maps cannot gain additional content, Essences, Shrines, or Strongboxes.
entries.description_plain: Contains a Unique Map layout which may contain specialised rewards. Unique Maps cannot gain additional content, Essences, Shrines, or Strongboxes.

entries.name: Hideout
entries.description_html:
Contains a Hideout that can be fully cleared to unlock the Hideout for personal use.

All monsters in the area are at least Magic.
entries.description_plain: Contains a Hideout that can be fully cleared to unlock the Hideout for personal use. All monsters in the area are at least Magic.

entries.name: Wandering Trader
entries.description_html: Contains a Wandering Trader who may offer you powerful rewards.
entries.description_plain: Contains a Wandering Trader who may offer you powerful rewards.

entries.name: Copper Citadel
entries.description_html:
The Copper Citadel is an endgame area which can be accessed with a Tier 15 or above Waystone. The boss of this area will drop a Crisis Fragment.

Increases to Waystone Drop Chance gives a chance for additional Crisis Fragments to drop.
entries.description_plain: The Copper Citadel is an endgame area which can be accessed with a Tier 15 or above Waystone. The boss of this area will drop a Crisis Fragment. Increases to Waystone Drop Chance gives a chance for additional Crisis Fragments to drop.

entries.name: Iron Citadel
entries.description_html:
The Iron Citadel is an endgame area which can be accessed with a Tier 15 or above Waystone. The boss of this area will drop a Crisis Fragment.

Increases to Waystone Drop Chance gives a chance for additional Crisis Fragments to drop.
entries.description_plain: The Iron Citadel is an endgame area which can be accessed with a Tier 15 or above Waystone. The boss of this area will drop a Crisis Fragment. Increases to Waystone Drop Chance gives a chance for additional Crisis Fragments to drop.

entries.name: Stone Citadel
entries.description_html:
The Stone Citadel is an endgame area which can be accessed with a Tier 15 or above Waystone. The boss of this area will drop a Crisis Fragment.

Increases to Waystone Drop Chance gives a chance for additional Crisis Fragments to drop.
entries.description_plain: The Stone Citadel is an endgame area which can be accessed with a Tier 15 or above Waystone. The boss of this area will drop a Crisis Fragment. Increases to Waystone Drop Chance gives a chance for additional Crisis Fragments to drop.

entries.name: The Burning Monolith
entries.description_html:
The Burning Monolith houses the most dangerous foe in all of Wraeclast.
Access to this foe requires three different Crisis Fragments from the Copper, Iron and Stone Citadels.
entries.description_plain: The Burning Monolith houses the most dangerous foe in all of Wraeclast. Access to this foe requires three different Crisis Fragments from the Copper, Iron and Stone Citadels.

entries.name: Map Node
entries.description_html:
This represents a Map. A Waystone can be used to access it.

If you fail to complete the Map, it may be attempted again but will not contain additional content, Essences, Shrines, or Strongboxes. It will not be Corrupted and cannot be influenced by Precursor Towers.

Maps between Tier 6 and Tier 10 have an additional 10% penalty to Elemental Resistances.

Maps between Tier 11 and Tier 16 have an additional 10% penalty to Elemental Resistances.

To complete a Map, defeat all Rare Enemies. In Maps with Bosses, you must additionally defeat the Boss to complete it.
entries.description_plain: This represents a Map. A Waystone can be used to access it. If you fail to complete the Map, it may be attempted again but will not contain additional content, Essences, Shrines, or Strongboxes. It will not be Corrupted and cannot be influenced by Precursor Towers. Maps between Tier 6 and Tier 10 have an additional 10% penalty to Elemental Resistances. Maps between Tier 11 and Tier 16 have an additional 10% penalty to Elemental Resistances. To complete a Map, defeat all Rare Enemies. In Maps with Bosses, you must additionally defeat the Boss to complete it.

entries.name: Cooldown Recovery Rate
entries.description_html:
Cooldown Recovery Rate modifies the speed at which your Skill cooldowns are restored. For example, with 100% increased Cooldown Recovery Rate your Skill cooldowns will effectively be halved.

Cooldown Recovery Rate does not affect anything other than Skill cooldowns.
entries.description_plain: Cooldown Recovery Rate modifies the speed at which your Skill cooldowns are restored. For example, with 100% increased Cooldown Recovery Rate your Skill cooldowns will effectively be halved. Cooldown Recovery Rate does not affect anything other than Skill cooldowns.

entries.name: Jewels
entries.description_html: Jewels are items that can be socketed into Jewel Sockets on the Passive Skill Tree to grant bonuses. Basic Jewels simply grant you the listed stats, while some other kinds of Jewel can have more complicated effects, such as modifying other Passive Skills within a certain radius.
entries.description_plain: Jewels are items that can be socketed into Jewel Sockets on the Passive Skill Tree to grant bonuses. Basic Jewels simply grant you the listed stats, while some other kinds of Jewel can have more complicated effects, such as modifying other Passive Skills within a certain radius.

entries.name: Iron Grip
entries.description_html:
Gain no inherent bonus from Strength
1% increased Projectile Attack damage per 2 Strength
entries.description_plain: Gain no inherent bonus from Strength 1% increased Projectile Attack damage per 2 Strength

entries.name: Iron Will
entries.description_html:
Gain no inherent bonus from Strength
1% increased Spell damage per 2 Strength
entries.description_plain: Gain no inherent bonus from Strength 1% increased Spell damage per 2 Strength

entries.name: Soul Eater
entries.description_html: Gain 1% increased Skill Speed for 4 seconds when an enemy dies in your Presence, stacking up to 50 times. A stack is lost every 0.5 seconds if one has not been gained within the past 4 seconds.
entries.description_plain: Gain 1% increased Skill Speed for 4 seconds when an enemy dies in your Presence, stacking up to 50 times. A stack is lost every 0.5 seconds if one has not been gained within the past 4 seconds.

entries.name: Leech
entries.description_html: Leech can recover Life, Mana, or Energy Shield over time, usually as a result of Hitting an enemy and based on the damage of the Hit.
entries.description_plain: Leech can recover Life, Mana, or Energy Shield over time, usually as a result of Hitting an enemy and based on the damage of the Hit.

entries.name: Historic Jewels
entries.description_html: You can only have one Historic Jewel socketed.
entries.description_plain: You can only have one Historic Jewel socketed.

entries.name: Catalysts
entries.description_html: Catalysts are Currency items that are exclusive drops from the Breach mechanic. Catalysts add Quality that affect certain modifiers on Ring and Amulet equipment.
entries.description_plain: Catalysts are Currency items that are exclusive drops from the Breach mechanic. Catalysts add Quality that affect certain modifiers on Ring and Amulet equipment.

entries.name: Omens
entries.description_html: Omens are Currency items that are exclusive drops from the Ritual mechanic. Omens enable exclusive meta-crafting effects, allowing for more specialised crafting.
entries.description_plain: Omens are Currency items that are exclusive drops from the Ritual mechanic. Omens enable exclusive meta-crafting effects, allowing for more specialised crafting.

entries.name: Logbooks
entries.description_html: Logbooks are items that are exclusive drops from the Expedition mechanic. Logbooks can be taken to Dannig to open a special area that is one very large Expedition Encounter.
entries.description_plain: Logbooks are items that are exclusive drops from the Expedition mechanic. Logbooks can be taken to Dannig to open a special area that is one very large Expedition Encounter.

entries.name: Audience With The King
entries.description_html: An Audience with the King is an item that is an exclusive drop from the Ritual mechanic. This item allows you to access the Crux of Nothingness via the Realmgate.
entries.description_plain: An Audience with the King is an item that is an exclusive drop from the Ritual mechanic. This item allows you to access the Crux of Nothingness via the Realmgate.

entries.name: Liquid Emotions
entries.description_html:
Liquid Emotions are Currency items that are exclusive drops from the Delirium mechanic. Liquid Emotions allow you to instil an amulet with a Notable Passive Skill from the Passive Tree. Instilling a Notable Passive Skill which you have already allocated normally will not grant its effects a second time.

Maps can also be instilled, adding various rewards while making them more challenging.
entries.description_plain: Liquid Emotions are Currency items that are exclusive drops from the Delirium mechanic. Liquid Emotions allow you to instil an amulet with a Notable Passive Skill from the Passive Tree. Instilling a Notable Passive Skill which you have already allocated normally will not grant its effects a second time. Maps can also be instilled, adding various rewards while making them more challenging.

entries.name: Corrupted Items
entries.description_html:
Certain items can be found Corrupted or made Corrupted using a Vaal Orb, changing their properties unpredictably.
Most methods of item crafting and modification cannot be used on Corrupted items. There is no penalty for using Corrupted items.
entries.description_plain: Certain items can be found Corrupted or made Corrupted using a Vaal Orb, changing their properties unpredictably. Most methods of item crafting and modification cannot be used on Corrupted items. There is no penalty for using Corrupted items.

entries.name: Mirrored Items
entries.description_html:
Certain items can be found Mirrored or made Mirrored using a Mirror of Kalandra.
Mirrored items are copies of an original item. Most methods of item crafting and modification cannot be used on Mirrored items.
entries.description_plain: Certain items can be found Mirrored or made Mirrored using a Mirror of Kalandra. Mirrored items are copies of an original item. Most methods of item crafting and modification cannot be used on Mirrored items.

entries.name: Hexproof
entries.description_html: Hexproof means that you are Unaffected by Curses.
entries.description_plain: Hexproof means that you are Unaffected by Curses.

entries.name: Runic
entries.description_html:
Runic Monsters are powerful monsters encountered in Expeditions.
Runic Monsters are more commonly found by using explosives on larger Expedition markers.
entries.description_plain: Runic Monsters are powerful monsters encountered in Expeditions. Runic Monsters are more commonly found by using explosives on larger Expedition markers.

entries.name: Coalesced Corruption
entries.description_html: Monsters slain close together have a chance to merge together and manifest powerful Monsters.
entries.description_plain: Monsters slain close together have a chance to merge together and manifest powerful Monsters.

entries.name: Perfect Timing
entries.description_html:
Certain Channelling skills have extra effects and benefits if released within a certain timing window while using the skill.
Certain support gems and items can modify the duration of that timing window.
entries.description_plain: Certain Channelling skills have extra effects and benefits if released within a certain timing window while using the skill. Certain support gems and items can modify the duration of that timing window.

entries.name: Limit
entries.description_html:
Certain skills can only have a limited number of effects active at once.
If a new effect is created while at the maximum number of effects, the oldest effect will dissapear.
Certain support gems and items can modify skill effect limits.
entries.description_plain: Certain skills can only have a limited number of effects active at once. If a new effect is created while at the maximum number of effects, the oldest effect will dissapear. Certain support gems and items can modify skill effect limits.

entries.name: Monster Soul Eater
entries.description_html: Monsters with Soul Eater gain 1% increased Skill Speed and 1% less damage taken for 4 seconds when a monster dies in their Presence, stacking up to 50 times. A stack is lost every 0.5 seconds if one has not been gained within the past 4 seconds.
entries.description_plain: Monsters with Soul Eater gain 1% increased Skill Speed and 1% less damage taken for 4 seconds when a monster dies in their Presence, stacking up to 50 times. A stack is lost every 0.5 seconds if one has not been gained within the past 4 seconds.

entries.name: Remnants
entries.description_html: Remnants are lingering objects in the world which are generally created by player Skills. Walking over a Remnant collects it to grant a bonus based on the type of Remnant. Remnants will generally disappear if not collected for some time.
entries.description_plain: Remnants are lingering objects in the world which are generally created by player Skills. Walking over a Remnant collects it to grant a bonus based on the type of Remnant. Remnants will generally disappear if not collected for some time.

entries.name: Ascendancy Points
entries.description_html:
Ascendancy Passive Skill Points can be allocated in your Ascendancy Skill Tree once you have chosen your Ascendancy. Your Ascendancy class is unlocked by completing any Ascension Trial. In order to change your Ascendancy, you must complete an Ascension Trial to the furthest extent you have successfully already done so, and then interact with the Ascendancy Altar while you have no Ascendancy Passive Skill Points currently assigned. Trialmaster and Balbala will offer the ability to refund passive points while in rooms with Ascendancy Altars to facilitate this.

You can obtain 4 sets of 2 Ascendancy Points for a total of 8 in the following ways:
Set 1 - Completing floor 1 of the Trial of the Sekhemas or completing the Trials of Chaos with at least 7 Trials
Set 2 - Completing floor 2 of the Trial of the Sekhemas or completing the Trials of Chaos
Set 3 - Completing floor 3 of the Trial of the Sekhemas or completing the Trials of Chaos with at least 10 Trials
Set 4 - Completing floor 4 of the Trial of the Sekhemas or completing the secret challenge behind the locked door in the Trials of Chaos
entries.description_plain: Ascendancy Passive Skill Points can be allocated in your Ascendancy Skill Tree once you have chosen your Ascendancy. entries.name: Honour Resistance
entries.description_html:
You lose this much less Honour.
Maximum Honour Resistance is capped at 75% by default and cannot be higher than 90%.
entries.description_plain: You lose this much less Honour. Maximum Honour Resistance is capped at 75% by default and cannot be higher than 90%.

entries.name: Stage-Gaining Skills
entries.description_html:
Skills can gain Stages passively or while attacking/casting them, depending on the Skill in question.

Stages gained for a given Skill apply to that instance of the Skill and will not carry over from one area to another.
entries.description_plain: Skills can gain Stages passively or while attacking/casting them, depending on the Skill in question. Stages gained for a given Skill apply to that instance of the Skill and will not carry over from one area to another.

entries.name: Primed for Pin
entries.description_html: Normal enemies are Primed for Pin when they have at least 40% Pin buildup. Magic enemies are instead Primed at 50% buildup, Rare at 60%, and Unique at 70%.
entries.description_plain: Normal enemies are Primed for Pin when they have at least 40% Pin buildup. Magic enemies are instead Primed at 50% buildup, Rare at 60%, and Unique at 70%.

entries.name: Elemental Surges
entries.description_html:
Elemental Surges are consumed when you use a non-Melee Projectile Attack to suffuse the Projectiles fired by that Attack, causing them to trigger a Surging Blast when they reach the end of their flight.

Your weapon can have a maximum of 6 of each type of Surge active by default. Surges last 15 seconds. Surges are specific to your current weapon, so do not affect non-weapon damage and are not carried over if you weapon swap.

Projectiles which Split or Fork do not gain the benefits of Surges.
entries.description_plain: Elemental Surges are consumed when you use a non-Melee Projectile Attack to suffuse the Projectiles fired by that Attack, causing them to trigger a Surging Blast when they reach the end of their flight. Your weapon can have a maximum of 6 of each type of Surge active by default. Surges last 15 seconds. Surges are specific to your current weapon, so do not affect non-weapon damage and are not carried over if you weapon swap. Projectiles which Split or Fork do not gain the benefits of Surges.

entries.name: Chaos Surge
entries.description_html: Chaos Surge behaves identically to Elemental Surges, but causes a Chaos blast.
entries.description_plain: Chaos Surge behaves identically to Elemental Surges, but causes a Chaos blast.

entries.name: Banner Skills
entries.description_html:
Banner Skills generate Glory when you attack a Monster while it is activated. Glory generated corresponds to the Power of the Monster hit. Once at full Glory, the Banner can be placed to create powerful Buffing Areas.
Normally you have a limit of a single Banner placed at one time.
entries.description_plain: Banner Skills generate Glory when you attack a Monster while it is activated. Glory generated corresponds to the Power of the Monster hit. Once at full Glory, the Banner can be placed to create powerful Buffing Areas. Normally you have a limit of a single Banner placed at one time.

entries.name: Conditional Usage
entries.description_html: Skills which are Conditional require some sort of condition to be met before they can be used. Combo is an example of this, but almost anything can be a condition, such as having to have killed a certain number of enemies Recently or having to have moved a certain distance.
entries.description_plain: Skills which are Conditional require some sort of condition to be met before they can be used. Combo is an example of this, but almost anything can be a condition, such as having to have killed a certain number of enemies Recently or having to have moved a certain distance.

entries.name: Whirlwinds
entries.description_html:
Whirlwinds Blind and Slow the movement speed of enemies within them. If their creator crosses the edge of the Whirlwind it collapses, damaging and Knocking Back enemies caught inside. The collapse deals Melee damage.

Trying to create a Whirlwind that would overlap with an existing Whirlwind instead moves the existing Whirlwind and grants it a stage, making it larger and more damaging.

A Whirlwind that overlaps an allied Elemental Ground Surface takes on that element, gaining 50% of damage as the corresponding type and applying the Ground Surface's debuff to enemies inside the Whirlwind for 4 seconds.
entries.description_plain: Whirlwinds Blind and Slow the movement speed of enemies within them. If their creator crosses the edge of the Whirlwind it collapses, damaging and Knocking Back enemies caught inside. The collapse deals Melee damage. Trying to create a Whirlwind that would overlap with an existing Whirlwind instead moves the existing Whirlwind and grants it a stage, making it larger and more damaging. A Whirlwind that overlaps an allied Elemental Ground Surface takes on that element, gaining 50% of damage as the corresponding type and applying the Ground Surface's debuff to enemies inside the Whirlwind for 4 seconds.

entries.name: Volatility
entries.description_html:
Volatility explodes after 4 seconds, dealing 100 Physical Damage to you per Volatility. For 10 seconds after explosion, you will gain Volatile Power, Gaining 1% of Damage as Chaos for each Volatility which exploded. The explosion timer will reset on gaining another stack of Volatility.

Volatility can be gained once every 0.1 seconds, and the default maximum for Volatility stacks on you at once is 200.
entries.description_plain: Volatility explodes after 4 seconds, dealing 100 Physical Damage to you per Volatility. For 10 seconds after explosion, you will gain Volatile Power, Gaining 1% of Damage as Chaos for each Volatility which exploded. The explosion timer will reset on gaining another stack of Volatility. Volatility can be gained once every 0.1 seconds, and the default maximum for Volatility stacks on you at once is 200.

entries.name: Bloodstained
entries.description_html:
While Bleeding enemies build up Bloodstained, gaining the Bloodstained Debuff after Bleeding for a total of 6 seconds. Bloodstained builds up 100% faster if the Bleeding enemy is moving or the Bleed is Aggravated.

Certain skills allow you to view the Bloodstained Debuff on enemies and can consume the Debuff for powerful effects.
entries.description_plain: While Bleeding enemies build up Bloodstained, gaining the Bloodstained Debuff after Bleeding for a total of 6 seconds. Bloodstained builds up 100% faster if the Bleeding enemy is moving or the Bleed is Aggravated. Certain skills allow you to view the Bloodstained Debuff on enemies and can consume the Debuff for powerful effects.

entries.name: Revealing Weaknesses
entries.description_html: Revealed Weaknesses are highlighted on enemy Life bars, and occupy a total of 45% of their maximum Life (but in random segments). While the enemy's current Life is within a highlighted segment, they are considered to have an Open Weakness.
entries.description_plain: Revealed Weaknesses are highlighted on enemy Life bars, and occupy a total of 45% of their maximum Life (but in random segments). While the enemy's current Life is within a highlighted segment, they are considered to have an Open Weakness.

entries.name: Resonance
entries.description_html:
Resonance is a buff granted by the Trinity skill. There are three types of Resonance: Fire, Cold and Lightning. You can have a maximum of 100 of each type of Resonance.

You lose 10 Resonance per second of specific types if you haven't gained Resonance of that type in the past 8 seconds.
entries.description_plain: Resonance is a buff granted by the Trinity skill. There are three types of Resonance: Fire, Cold and Lightning. You can have a maximum of 100 of each type of Resonance. You lose 10 Resonance per second of specific types if you haven't gained Resonance of that type in the past 8 seconds.

entries.name: Incision
entries.description_html:
Incision is a Debuff which causes the affected target to gain increasingly higher chance to be inflicted with Bleeding when Hit. All Incision stacks are removed when Bleeding is inflicted.

Each stack of Incision applies 10% chance to be inflicted with Bleeding when Hit. A maximum of 10 Incision stacks can be present on a target at once.
entries.description_plain: Incision is a Debuff which causes the affected target to gain increasingly higher chance to be inflicted with Bleeding when Hit. All Incision stacks are removed when Bleeding is inflicted. Each stack of Incision applies 10% chance to be inflicted with Bleeding when Hit. A maximum of 10 Incision stacks can be present on a target at once.

entries.name: Retaliate with Thorns
entries.description_html:
Retaliating specifically refers only to the inherent ability to deal Thorns damage to enemies when they Hit you.

Some effects may cause you to deal Thorns damage in other ways, but those are not Retaliation, and effects which specifically care about when you Retaliate will ignore them.
entries.description_plain: Retaliating specifically refers only to the inherent ability to deal Thorns damage to enemies when they Hit you. Some effects may cause you to deal Thorns damage in other ways, but those are not Retaliation, and effects which specifically care about when you Retaliate will ignore them.

entries.name: Companions
entries.description_html: Companions are a type of Reviving Minion that are more complex and powerful than typical Minions. By default you can only have one Companion of any type summoned at a time.
entries.description_plain: Companions are a type of Reviving Minion that are more complex and powerful than typical Minions. By default you can only have one Companion of any type summoned at a time.

entries.name: Monster Category
entries.description_html:
Every Monster has exactly one Monster Category. These are Humanoid, Beast, Undead, Construct, Demon and Eldritch.

Certain Skills interact with specific Monster Categories.
entries.description_plain: Every Monster has exactly one Monster Category. These are Humanoid, Beast, Undead, Construct, Demon and Eldritch. Certain Skills interact with specific Monster Categories.

entries.name: Hobble
entries.description_html:
Hobbling a target lowers their Evasion by a specified amount. If this brings that target's Evasion value to 0, they are fully Hobbled for 12 seconds.

Hobble from Players lowers Evasion by 3 times as much against Normal Monsters and 2 times as much against Magic Monsters.
entries.description_plain: Hobbling a target lowers their Evasion by a specified amount. If this brings that target's Evasion value to 0, they are fully Hobbled for 12 seconds. Hobble from Players lowers Evasion by 3 times as much against Normal Monsters and 2 times as much against Magic Monsters.

entries.name: Hazards
entries.description_html: Hazards are objects created in the world (usually by some player skill) and which are destroyed when traversed by an enemy, dealing damage and/or applying some effect to the enemy which triggered the Hazard.
entries.description_plain: Hazards are objects created in the world (usually by some player skill) and which are destroyed when traversed by an enemy, dealing damage and/or applying some effect to the enemy which triggered the Hazard.

entries.name: Unholy Might
entries.description_html: Unholy Might is a Buff that grants 30% of all damage as extra Chaos Damage.
entries.description_plain: Unholy Might is a Buff that grants 30% of all damage as extra Chaos Damage.

entries.name: Impale
entries.description_html:
Impale is a Debuff inflicted by Hits, which stores 30% of the Pre-mitigation Physical Hit damage of the Impaling hit as its Magnitude.

Subsequent Attack Hits against Impaled targets will Extract the Impale debuff. When this occurs, the Magnitude of the Impale is added to the Pre-mitigation Physical damage of that attack hit.

A maximum of 60 Impale Debuffs can be present on a target at once. If multiple Impales are present on a target, each Attack's Hit only Extracts and benefits from the strongest one of them.
entries.description_plain: Impale is a Debuff inflicted by Hits, which stores 30% of the Pre-mitigation Physical Hit damage of the Impaling hit as its Magnitude. Subsequent Attack Hits against Impaled targets will Extract the Impale debuff. When this occurs, the Magnitude of the Impale is added to the Pre-mitigation Physical damage of that attack hit. A maximum of 60 Impale Debuffs can be present on a target at once. If multiple Impales are present on a target, each Attack's Hit only Extracts and benefits from the strongest one of them.

entries.name: Blood Loss
entries.description_html: All Physical damage over time taken by a target (including Bleeding) is accumulated as Blood Loss.
entries.description_plain: All Physical damage over time taken by a target (including Bleeding) is accumulated as Blood Loss.

entries.name: Perfection Buff
entries.description_html:
Perfection lasts for 10 seconds and can stack up to 4 times, granting 5% more Damage per stack. This Damage bonus is not limited to Skills Supported by Perfection Support.

Failing to successfully execute any Perfect Timing will remove all Perfection stacks on you.
entries.description_plain: Perfection lasts for 10 seconds and can stack up to 4 times, granting 5% more Damage per stack. This Damage bonus is not limited to Skills Supported by Perfection Support. Failing to successfully execute any Perfect Timing will remove all Perfection stacks on you.

entries.name: Killing Blow
entries.description_html: A Killing Blow is any Hit Damage which successfully reduces a target to zero Life, killing them. Damage over time cannot cause Killing Blows.
entries.description_plain: A Killing Blow is any Hit Damage which successfully reduces a target to zero Life, killing them. Damage over time cannot cause Killing Blows.

entries.name: Bifurcated Critical Hits
entries.description_html:
Hits with this weapon roll against their Critical Hit chance twice when determining if they are a Critical Hit.

If either roll succeeds, the hit will be a Critical Hit, and thus the Critical Damage Bonus will apply as normal.

If both rolls succeed, the hit will be a Critical Hit, and the Critical Damage Bonus will apply twice to that Hit.

If a modifier makes your Critical Hit Chance Lucky, that Luck will apply individually to both of these rolls.
entries.description_plain: Hits with this weapon roll against their Critical Hit chance twice when determining if they are a Critical Hit. If either roll succeeds, the hit will be a Critical Hit, and thus the Critical Damage Bonus will apply as normal. If both rolls succeed, the hit will be a Critical Hit, and the Critical Damage Bonus will apply twice to that Hit. If a modifier makes your Critical Hit Chance Lucky, that Luck will apply individually to both of these rolls.

entries.name: Pre-mitigation Damage
entries.description_html:
Your Pre-mitigation Damage is the damage of your hits after all your modifiers to damage have been applied, but before the target's mitigation, such as Armour, Resistances or Blocking, prevents any of that damage.

The target's modifiers to Damage taken apply after their mitigation, so Pre-mitigation Damage also does not include the effects of those modifiers. However, modifiers that cause the target to take damage as a different Type occur before mitigating the damage, so are included in Pre-mitigation Damage.
entries.description_plain: Your Pre-mitigation Damage is the damage of your hits after all your modifiers to damage have been applied, but before the target's mitigation, such as Armour, Resistances or Blocking, prevents any of that damage. The target's modifiers to Damage taken apply after their mitigation, so Pre-mitigation Damage also does not include the effects of those modifiers. However, modifiers that cause the target to take damage as a different Type occur before mitigating the damage, so are included in Pre-mitigation Damage.

entries.name: Easy Target
entries.description_html: Easy Target is a Debuff which causes the next Projectile Attack Hit against the affected target to deal increased Damage, at which point the Debuff is consumed.
entries.description_plain: Easy Target is a Debuff which causes the next Projectile Attack Hit against the affected target to deal increased Damage, at which point the Debuff is consumed.

entries.name: Expected Knockback
entries.description_html: The Expected Knockback distance is the distance a target would be Knocked Back were there nothing impeding that Knockback, such as terrain, other entities, or other mitigating circumstances.
entries.description_plain: The Expected Knockback distance is the distance a target would be Knocked Back were there nothing impeding that Knockback, such as terrain, other entities, or other mitigating circumstances.

entries.name: Rogue Exile
entries.description_html:
Rogue Exiles are dangerous foes that wander Wraeclast and Maps.
They have access to the same Skills, Items, and Uniques that you do. This can make them very formidable opponents - however, if they can be defeated they will drop a full set of gear, including any Unique equipment that they were using in combat.
If any Rogue Exile manages to defeat you, they will portal away, taking their equipment with them.
entries.description_plain: Rogue Exiles are dangerous foes that wander Wraeclast and Maps. They have access to the same Skills, Items, and Uniques that you do. This can make them very formidable opponents - however, if they can be defeated they will drop a full set of gear, including any Unique equipment that they were using in combat. If any Rogue Exile manages to defeat you, they will portal away, taking their equipment with them.

entries.name: Azmeri Spirit
entries.description_html:
Azmeri Spirits are the spirits of various Azmeri Animal Guardians.
Azmeri Spirits appear as wisps that flee as you approach them. Normal or Magic Monsters the Spirit comes into contact with become Spirit-Influenced, making them more powerful.
Sometimes the Spirit will reach and Possess a Rare or Unique monster, making them substantially stronger and rewarding while occasionally summoning spiritual animals depending on the type of Animal Spirit they represent.
Possessed monsters are more rewarding depending on how many Spirit-Influenced monsters were defeated leading up to possession.
entries.description_plain: Azmeri Spirits are the spirits of various Azmeri Animal Guardians. Azmeri Spirits appear as wisps that flee as you approach them. Normal or Magic Monsters the Spirit comes into contact with become Spirit-Influenced, making them more powerful. Sometimes the Spirit will reach and Possess a Rare or Unique monster, making them substantially stronger and rewarding while occasionally summoning spiritual animals depending on the type of Animal Spirit they represent. Possessed monsters are more rewarding depending on how many Spirit-Influenced monsters were defeated leading up to possession.

entries.name: Possessed
entries.description_html:
A Possessed monster is a Rare or Unique monster that has had an Azmeri Spirit enter and empower them. The possessed monster is empowered by the spirit and gains bonuses depending on the type of Spirit that possessed them. Occasionally the possessed monster will summon spiritual animals depending on the type of Animal Spirit they represent.
Possessed monsters are more rewarding depending on how many Spirit-Influenced monsters were defeated leading up to possession.
entries.description_plain: A Possessed monster is a Rare or Unique monster that has had an Azmeri Spirit enter and empower them. The possessed monster is empowered by the spirit and gains bonuses depending on the type of Spirit that possessed them. Occasionally the possessed monster will summon spiritual animals depending on the type of Animal Spirit they represent. Possessed monsters are more rewarding depending on how many Spirit-Influenced monsters were defeated leading up to possession.

entries.name: Spirit-Influenced
entries.description_html:
A Spirit-Influenced monster is a Normal or Magic monster that has been passed through by an Azmeri Spirit. These monsters are empowered by the spirit and gain bonuses depending on the type of Spirit that passed through them.
Defeating Spirit-Influenced monsters makes the resulting Possessed monster more rewarding.
entries.description_plain: A Spirit-Influenced monster is a Normal or Magic monster that has been passed through by an Azmeri Spirit. These monsters are empowered by the spirit and gain bonuses depending on the type of Spirit that passed through them. Defeating Spirit-Influenced monsters makes the resulting Possessed monster more rewarding.

entries.name: Extra Content
entries.description_html: Random Extra Content is Shrines, Strongboxes, Essences, Rogue Exiles and Azmeri Spirits.
entries.description_plain: Random Extra Content is Shrines, Strongboxes, Essences, Rogue Exiles and Azmeri Spirits.

entries.description_plain: Seeking Shrines grant increased Rarity of Items Found.

entries.name: Enlightening Shrine
entries.description_html: Enlightening Shrines cause you to gain increased Experience.
entries.description_plain: Enlightening Shrines cause you to gain increased Experience.

entries.name: Greed Shrine
entries.description_html: Greed Shrines cause item drops to be converted to Gold and monsters to drop increased Gold.
entries.description_plain: Greed Shrines cause item drops to be converted to Gold and monsters to drop increased Gold.

entries.description_html: Cartographer's Strongboxes drop Waystones.
entries.description_plain: Cartographer's Strongboxes drop Waystones.

entries.description_plain: Ornate Strongboxes have improved dropped Item Rarity.

entries.name: Effective Chance
entries.description_html:
Some effects manipulate how random chances are rolled in ways that affect the result without changing the stated chance for the effect, such as a chance being Lucky causing it to be rolled twice and use the better result, or an effect skipping the roll entirely to force something to succeed or fail. The Effective chance is the real chance to get a specific result, accounting for all such roll-manipulating effects.

For example, if you had a Critical Hit chance of 20%, and your Critical Hit chance was Lucky, you would have an Effective Critical Hit chance of 36%, which is the chance that at least one of the two 20% rolls succeeds.
entries.description_plain: Some effects manipulate how random chances are rolled in ways that affect the result without changing the stated chance for the effect, such as a chance being Lucky causing it to be rolled twice and use the better result, or an effect skipping the roll entirely to force something to succeed or fail. The Effective chance is the real chance to get a specific result, accounting for all such roll-manipulating effects. For example, if you had a Critical Hit chance of 20%, and your Critical Hit chance was Lucky, you would have an Effective Critical Hit chance of 36%, which is the chance that at least one of the two 20% rolls succeeds.

entries.name: Crimson Assault
entries.description_html: Bleeding you inflict is Aggravated and base Bleeding Duration is 1 second.
entries.description_plain: Bleeding you inflict is Aggravated and base Bleeding Duration is 1 second.

entries.name: Equipped
entries.description_html: Weapon, Armour, Belt, and Jewellery Items are Equipped to the character in the Inventory Panel. Flasks, Skill Gems, and Jewels are never considered to be Equipped.
entries.description_plain: Weapon, Armour, Belt, and Jewellery Items are Equipped to the character in the Inventory Panel. Flasks, Skill Gems, and Jewels are never considered to be Equipped.

entries.name: Jewellery
entries.description_html: Amulets and Rings are considered Jewellery
entries.description_plain: Amulets and Rings are considered Jewellery

entries.name: Equipment
entries.description_html: Equipment are items that can be Equipped
entries.description_plain: Equipment are items that can be Equipped

entries.name: Only Minimum or Maximum Damage
entries.description_html:
This weapon's hits will not roll a random value between the minimum or maximum damage value, but instead will always roll either the minimum value or the maximum value, with a 50% chance for each.

Each Damage Type has its damage value rolled separately, so if the hit deals multiple types of damage, some types may roll the maximum while others are at minimum.

If the damage rolls are Lucky, that will still apply, make this roll twice and picking the maximum if either roll had that result, only picking minimum damage if both rolls selected minimum. Unlucky damage rolls will prefer minimum damage in the same way.

Unlucky damage rolls will prefer minimum damage in the same way.

entries.name: Trusted Kinship
entries.description_html:
You can have two Companions of different types
You have 30% less Defences
Companions have +1 to each Defence for every 2 of that Defence you have

entries.description_html: Absorption effects include Guard, Encased in Jade and Sorcery Ward.
entries.description_plain: Absorption effects include Guard, Encased in Jade and Sorcery Ward.

entries.name: Parry
entries.description_html: Parry is a Skill granted by Bucklers that allows you to Block and retaliate against an enemy Strike or Projectile, leaving them off balance and inflicting the Parried Debuff.
entries.description_plain: Parry is a Skill granted by Bucklers that allows you to Block and retaliate against an enemy Strike or Projectile, leaving them off balance and inflicting the Parried Debuff.

entries.description_html: Enemies you Parry with a Buckler take more Attack Damage and cannot Evade Attacks for a duration.
entries.description_plain: Enemies you Parry with a Buckler take more Attack Damage and cannot Evade Attacks for a duration.

entries.name: Everlasting Sacrifice
entries.description_html: When you reach full Energy Shield, Sacrifice all Energy Shield to gain +5% to all Maximum Resistances for 4 seconds

entries.name: Aggravating any Bleeding
entries.description_html:
This effect will occur when a hit with the weapon directly causes at least one Bleeding Debuff on the target to become Aggravated.

It will not occur if an on-hit effect tries to Aggravate Bleeding but there are no Bleeding Debuffs on the target to Aggravate, or all of them are already Aggravated, since no Bleeding Debuffs will be Aggravated by that hit.

It will not occur if an on-hit effect tries to Aggravate Bleeding but there are no Bleeding Debuffs on the target to Aggravate, or all of them are already Aggravated, since no Bleeding Debuffs will be Aggravated by that hit.

entries.name: Detonation Time
entries.description_html: Skills with a Detonation Time Detonate once this time has elapsed. This time is not affected by duration modifiers.

entries.name: Waystone Tier Progression
entries.description_html:
Only Final Map Bosses in a Map Area have a chance to drop a Waystone of a higher tier than the tier of that Map Area.

The chance diminishes the higher the tier of the Waystone used to the create the Map Area, but can be increased again by adding modifiers to Waystones, additional modifiers on Waystones can give increased chance for Waystones to drop in the Map Areas they create.

The chance diminishes the higher the tier of the Waystone used to the create the Map Area, but can be increased again by adding modifiers to Waystones, additional modifiers on Waystones can give increased chance for Waystones to drop in the Map Areas they create.

entries.name: Final Rare Monster Waystone Drops
entries.description_html:
The final Rare Monster slain in a Map Area has a chance to drop a Waystone equal to the tier of the Waystone used to create that Map Area.

The chance diminishes the tier of the Waystone used to the create the Map Area, but can be increased again by adding modifiers to Waystones, additional modifiers on Waystones can give increased chance for Waystones to drop in the Map Areas they create.

entries.description_html: A Corrupted Nexus is the source of immense corruption, guarded by a powerful monster.
entries.description_plain: A Corrupted Nexus is the source of immense corruption, guarded by a powerful monster.

entries.name: Retaliate against all Hits
entries.description_html: This allows your Thorns to Retaliate against any kind of Hit dealt to you by enemies, rather than just Melee Attacks, except that you can never Retaliate against the enemy's Thorns damage.
entries.description_plain: This allows your Thorns to Retaliate against any kind of Hit dealt to you by enemies, rather than just Melee Attacks, except that you can never Retaliate against the enemy's Thorns damage.

entries.name: Take Mana Costs as Damage
entries.description_html:
Upfront Costs will result in taking the damage all at once as a Hit.

A per-second costs will instead result in taking Damage per second, which is damage over time, and thus not a Hit.
entries.description_plain: Upfront Costs will result in taking the damage all at once as a Hit. A per-second costs will instead result in taking Damage per second, which is damage over time, and thus not a Hit.

entries.name: Upfront Costs
entries.description_html:
An upfront cost is one that lists just an amount of resource to pay, rather than a per-second rate to pay at.

"3 Mana" is an Upfront Cost, while "3 Mana per second" is not.
entries.description_plain: An upfront cost is one that lists just an amount of resource to pay, rather than a per-second rate to pay at. "3 Mana" is an Upfront Cost, while "3 Mana per second" is not.

entries.name: Account Bound
entries.description_html: Account Bound items cannot be traded to other players, but can be shared between other characters on your account.
entries.description_plain: Account Bound items cannot be traded to other players, but can be shared between other characters on your account.

entries.name: Essence of Delirium
entries.description_html: A monster empowered by an Essence of Delirium will periodically summon the demons that lay behind the Delirium Mirror.
entries.description_plain: A monster empowered by an Essence of Delirium will periodically summon the demons that lay behind the Delirium Mirror.

entries.name: Cleansed
entries.description_html:
The Corruption in this area has been Cleansed, which may add an additional modifier to the area.

Cleansed areas also contain monsters twisted by the disruption of power in the area.
entries.description_plain: The Corruption in this area has been Cleansed, which may add an additional modifier to the area. Cleansed areas also contain monsters twisted by the disruption of power in the area.

entries.name: Delirious Players
entries.description_html: Delirious players are assaulted by illusions, making combat more difficult. Higher delirium causes monsters to deal more damage and have additional Toughness. It can also cause additional monsters to appear or can grant additional modifiers to existing monsters. Monster item drops are improved by higher delirium.

entries.name: Chances in excess of 100%
entries.description_html: By default, chance-based stats cap at 100% chance for the result to occur. However, some chances can exceed 100%. In this case, the result occurs once for each 100% chance you have, plus a normal percentage chance for it to occur again based on the remaining value.

entries.description_html: Players possessed by Spirits of the Azmeri gain powerful buffs depending on what Spirit Animal has possessed them. Spiritual beasts will occasionally be summoned to aid the player. Players can only be possessed by one Spirit at a time.

entries.name: Vulnerability
entries.description_html: Vulnerability is a Curse that lowers the Armour of those affected. If not otherwise specified, Vulnerability removes 191 Armour.

entries.name: Despair
entries.description_html: Despair is a Curse that lowers the Chaos Resistance of those affected. If not otherwise specified, Despair lowers Chaos Resistance by 25%.
entries.description_plain: Despair is a Curse that lowers the Chaos Resistance of those affected. If not otherwise specified, Despair lowers Chaos Resistance by 25%.

entries.name: Temporal Chains
entries.description_html: Temporal Chains is a Curse that slows those affected and makes other effects on them expire more slowly. If not otherwise specified, Temporal Chains slows by 26%.
entries.description_plain: Temporal Chains is a Curse that slows those affected and makes other effects on them expire more slowly. If not otherwise specified, Temporal Chains slows by 26%.

entries.name: Resisted by Other Value
entries.description_html:
Damage from your Hits will effectively ignore the value of the target's relevant Resistance, and instead be mitigated by the specified value of Resistance.

This will still occur even if you Ignore the target's Resistance, as this mitigation is not based on their Resistance stats. Similarly, Penetration will not apply to this Resistance value.

entries.name: Glory
entries.description_html:
Glory is a resource that must be spent to use certain powerful Skills. These Skills each have a method of generating Glory, and actions taken against enemies will generate Glory equal to the monster's Power. Different Skills gain and lose Glory separately, and each Skill can only generate Glory once every 2 seconds per monster.

Different Skills have different Glory requirements. Skills lose 2 Glory per second if they haven't gained Glory in the past 15 seconds. You cannot gain Glory for a Skill while any instance of that Skill is active unless that Skill is a Banner, but different Skills can generate Glory from the same Glorious action.

entries.name: Mounting Greed
entries.description_html:
Players with Mounting Greed gain increased Rarity of Items on kill up to a limit of 100%. This increased Rarity decays over time.

Higher Rarity monsters grant a greater amount of Rarity.

entries.name: Obelisk of Corruption
entries.description_html: An Obelisk of Corruption is an object that activates once a player gets close enough; granting a 10 second Buff that makes enemies killed by you explode, dealing 10% of their life as Physical damage.
entries.description_plain: An Obelisk of Corruption is an object that activates once a player gets close enough; granting a 10 second Buff that makes enemies killed by you explode, dealing 10% of their life as Physical damage.

entries.name: Obelisk of Cleansing
entries.description_html: An Obelisk of Cleansing is an object that activates once a player gets close enough; granting a 10 second Buff that grants 100% Item Rarity, 50% increased Defences and makes players Gain 30% of Damage as extra Lightning Damage.

entries.name: Immured Fury
entries.description_html: The Immured Fury is a powerful monster that has appeared due to the Cleansing process. This monster has dangerous abilities but greatly increased rewards.

entries.name: Fractured Modifiers
entries.description_html: A Fractured Modifier is locked onto the item permanently. It cannot be removed or altered.
entries.description_plain: A Fractured Modifier is locked onto the item permanently. It cannot be removed or altered.

entries.name: Weapon Sets
entries.description_html:
Your character has two Weapon Sets that can be used independently by equipping items into both sets.

By default your Skills will use the currently active Weapon Set if possible, or automatically swap to your other Weapon Set if required to use the Skill. You can also specify the Weapon Set you want to automatically swap to for each Skill in that Skill's information panel.

In addition to changing your active items, Weapon Sets also have dedicated Passive Skill Points that can be allocated differently in each Weapon Set.

Weapon Sets can have differing amounts of available Spirit, due to weapons with Spirit (such as Sceptres), Weapon Set Passive Skills, or Persistent Skills that are active in specific Weapon Sets.

entries.name: Lightning Mirages When Hit

entries.description_plain: Monster creates a 90% damage absorption barrier that explodes after taking a certain amount of damage, dealing Fire Damage

entries.name: Siphons Mana and Deals Lightning Damage

entries.description_plain: Monster creates a circular effect that drains Mana and deals Lightning Damage over time to enemies near the edge of the circle.

entries.name: Siphons Mana and Deals Lightning Damage
entries.description_html:
Monster creates a circular effect that drains Mana and deals Lightning Damage over time to enemies near the edge of the circle.
Additionally, Monster will periodically create separate circles that drain Mana and deal Lightning Damage over time to enemies standing in them.
entries.description_plain: Monster creates a circular effect that drains Mana and deals Lightning Damage over time to enemies near the edge of the circle. entries.description_plain: Monster has 25% increased Damage and 50% increased Life

entries.description_html: Monster periodically Enrages; gaining 30% increased Damage, 25% increased Skill and Movement Speed and 33% less damage taken for 5 seconds every 10 seconds.
entries.description_plain: Monster periodically Enrages; gaining 30% increased Damage, 25% increased Skill and Movement Speed and 33% less damage taken for 5 seconds every 10 seconds.

entries.description_plain: Monster creates an Aura that grants 40% increased Physical Damage to Allies within 5 metres.

entries.name: Prevents Recovery Above 50%
entries.description_html: Monster creates an Aura that Debuffs enemies within 4.2 metres, causing their Life and Energy Shield to not be able to recover past 50%.
entries.description_plain: Monster creates an Aura that Debuffs enemies within 4.2 metres, causing their Life and Energy Shield to not be able to recover past 50%.

entries.description_html: Monster cannot be damaged by enemies any further than 3 metres from them.
entries.description_plain: Monster cannot be damaged by enemies any further than 3 metres from them.

entries.description_html: Monster creates an Aura that grants +35% to all Elemental Resistances to Allies within 5 metres.
entries.description_plain: Monster creates an Aura that grants +35% to all Elemental Resistances to Allies within 5 metres.

entries.description_html: Monster periodically revives Pack Minions.
entries.description_plain: Monster periodically revives Pack Minions.

entries.description_plain: Monster periodically revives Pack Minions.

entries.description_html: Monster leaves a trail of Shocked Ground as they move.
entries.description_plain: Monster leaves a trail of Shocked Ground as they move.

entries.name: Shroud Walker
entries.description_html: Monster periodically teleports to an enemy they can see, creating a Smoke Cloud where they leave and where they teleport to.
entries.description_plain: Monster periodically teleports to an enemy they can see, creating a Smoke Cloud where they leave and where they teleport to.

entries.name: Powerful Minions
entries.description_html: Monster's Pack Minions have 25% increased Damage and 50% increased Life.
entries.description_plain: Monster's Pack Minions have 25% increased Damage and 50% increased Life.

entries.name: Stuns
entries.description_html: Monster has 100% increased Stun buildup.
entries.description_plain: Monster has 100% increased Stun buildup.

entries.description_html: Monster has 250% increased Stun Threshold.
entries.description_plain: Monster has 250% increased Stun Threshold.

entries.name: Temporal Bubble
entries.description_html: Monster creates an Aura that Debuffs Enemies within 3.2 metres; Slowing by 25%, making effects expire 40% slower and reducing Cooldown Recovery Rate by 60%.
entries.description_plain: Monster creates an Aura that Debuffs Enemies within 3.2 metres; Slowing by 25%, making effects expire 40% slower and reducing Cooldown Recovery Rate by 60%.

entries.name: Volatile Plants
entries.description_html: Monster periodically creates Volatile Plants, releasing orbs that move towards enemies; exploding when they get close enough; dealing Chaos Damage.
entries.description_plain: Monster periodically creates Volatile Plants, releasing orbs that move towards enemies; exploding when they get close enough; dealing Chaos Damage.

entries.name: Empowering Volatile Plants
entries.description_html: Monster periodically creates Powerful Volatile Plants, releasing orbs that move towards enemies; exploding when they get close enough; dealing Chaos Damage.
entries.description_plain: Monster periodically creates Powerful Volatile Plants, releasing orbs that move towards enemies; exploding when they get close enough; dealing Chaos Damage.

entries.name: Volatile Crag
entries.description_html: Monster periodically creates Volatile Crag that moves towards enemies; exploding when they get close enough; dealing Fire Damage.
entries.description_plain: Monster periodically creates Volatile Crag that moves towards enemies; exploding when they get close enough; dealing Fire Damage.

entries.name: Pack
entries.description_html:
A Pack Monster or Minion is a Monster that naturally spawns as a part of a Monster Pack in areas or from mechanics like Strongboxes.
Monsters or Minions created by other Monsters do not count as Pack Monsters or Minions.
entries.description_plain: A Pack Monster or Minion is a Monster that naturally spawns as a part of a Monster Pack in areas or from mechanics like Strongboxes. Monsters or Minions created by other Monsters do not count as Pack Monsters or Minions.

entries.name: Crescendo Arrows
entries.description_html: Crescendo Arrows Chain 6 additional times and deal 60% increased Damage for each time they have Chained.
entries.description_plain: Crescendo Arrows Chain 6 additional times and deal 60% increased Damage for each time they have Chained.

entries.name: Splinter Arrows
entries.description_html: Splintering Arrows Split towards 6 targets.
entries.description_plain: Splintering Arrows Split towards 6 targets.

entries.name: Reversing Arrows
entries.description_html: Reversing Arrows Pierce all targets and Return to you.
entries.description_plain: Reversing Arrows Pierce all targets and Return to you.

entries.name: Diamond Arrows
entries.description_html: All Hits with Diamond Arrows are Critical Hits with 60% increased Critical Damage Bonus.
entries.description_plain: All Hits with Diamond Arrows are Critical Hits with 60% increased Critical Damage Bonus.

entries.name: Covetous Arrows
entries.description_html: Enemies killed with Covetous Arrows drop items with 600% increased Rarity.
entries.description_plain: Enemies killed with Covetous Arrows drop items with 600% increased Rarity.

entries.name: Blunt Arrows
entries.description_html: Blunt Arrows cause 600% increased Stun Buildup.
entries.description_plain: Blunt Arrows cause 600% increased Stun Buildup.

entries.name: Repeating Skills
entries.description_html:
Some effects can cause Barrageable Skills to Repeat, causing you to perform the part of the skill where it fires off projectiles or other effects multiple times in quick succession from a single use of the skill.

Skills take 5% longer to perform for each time they Repeat.
entries.description_plain: Some effects can cause Barrageable Skills to Repeat, causing you to perform the part of the skill where it fires off projectiles or other effects multiple times in quick succession from a single use of the skill. Skills take 5% longer to perform for each time they Repeat.

entries.name: Guided Meteoric Shrine
entries.description_html: Meteors rain down around you when in range of enemies.
entries.description_plain: Meteors rain down around you when in range of enemies.

entries.name: Guided Tempest Shrine
entries.description_html: Lightning bolts strike the ground around you when in range of enemies.
entries.description_plain: Lightning bolts strike the ground around you when in range of enemies.

entries.name: Guided Freezing Shrine
entries.description_html: Freezing shards fire around you in a spiral when in range of enemies.
entries.description_plain: Freezing shards fire around you in a spiral when in range of enemies.

entries.name: Dreaming Gloom Shrine
entries.description_html: Slain enemies explode, dealing Chaos damage equal to a quarter of their maximum Life.
entries.description_plain: Slain enemies explode, dealing Chaos damage equal to a quarter of their maximum Life.

entries.name: Abyssal Wasting
entries.description_html: Abyssal Wasting reduces Life Regeneration Rate by 50% for 6 seconds
entries.description_plain: Abyssal Wasting reduces Life Regeneration Rate by 50% for 6 seconds

entries.name: Equippable Armours
entries.description_html: Equippable Armours are pieces of equipment that you can wear to provide various defences. Equippable Armours include Helmets, Body Armours, Gloves, Boots, Shields and Foci.
entries.description_plain: Equippable Armours are pieces of equipment that you can wear to provide various defences. Equippable Armours include Helmets, Body Armours, Gloves, Boots, Shields and Foci.

entries.name: Caster Weapon
entries.description_html: Caster Weapons are Sceptres, Staves and Wands.
entries.description_plain: Caster Weapons are Sceptres, Staves and Wands.

entries.name: Spectral Fire
entries.description_html: Targets affected by a Spectral Fire Debuff do not take damage from Ignite. Instead that damage feeds the Spectral Fire. When the Spectral Fire Debuff expires or the target dies, the Spectral Fire explodes, dealing all the damage it has absorbed to all enemies within 1.8m, including the affected target.
entries.description_plain: Targets affected by a Spectral Fire Debuff do not take damage from Ignite. Instead that damage feeds the Spectral Fire. When the Spectral Fire Debuff expires or the target dies, the Spectral Fire explodes, dealing all the damage it has absorbed to all enemies within 1.8m, including the affected target.

entries.name: Sanctified Items
entries.description_html:
Sanctifying an item will randomise the numeric values of its modifiers, then multiply the values of those modifiers by a random value ranging from 80% to 120%. The resulting item will now be Sanctified.
Most methods of item crafting and modification cannot be used on Sanctified items.
entries.description_plain: Sanctifying an item will randomise the numeric values of its modifiers, then multiply the values of those modifiers by a random value ranging from 80% to 120%. The resulting item will now be Sanctified. Most methods of item crafting and modification cannot be used on Sanctified items.

entries.name: Efficiency
entries.description_html: Efficiency modifiers act as divisors to the stat they modify. For example, 50% increased Reservation Efficiency causes your Reservations to be 67% of their base value, 100% increased Reservation Efficiency causes your Reservations to be 50% of their base value, and so on. Reduced Reservation Efficiency will cause the modified stat to grow larger instead of smaller.
entries.description_plain: Efficiency modifiers act as divisors to the stat they modify. For example, 50% increased Reservation Efficiency causes your Reservations to be 67% of their base value, 100% increased Reservation Efficiency causes your Reservations to be 50% of their base value, and so on. Reduced Reservation Efficiency will cause the modified stat to grow larger instead of smaller.

entries.name: Item Defences
entries.description_html: Stats that refer to an item's Armour, Evasion Rating and/or Energy Shield use the exact value of those Defences listed on the item. This means that Quality and local modifiers on the item are taken into account, but stats from other sources that change the amount of Defence actually granted to your character are not considered.
entries.description_plain: Stats that refer to an item's Armour, Evasion Rating and/or Energy Shield use the exact value of those Defences listed on the item. This means that Quality and local modifiers on the item are taken into account, but stats from other sources that change the amount of Defence actually granted to your character are not considered.

entries.name: Blackflame Covenant
entries.description_html:
Fire Spells Convert 100% of Fire Damage to Chaos Damage
Chaos Damage from Fire Spells Contributes to Flammability and Ignite Magnitudes
Ignite inflicted with Fire Spells deals Chaos Damage instead of Fire Damage
entries.description_plain: Fire Spells Convert 100% of Fire Damage to Chaos Damage Chaos Damage from Fire Spells Contributes to Flammability and Ignite Magnitudes Ignite inflicted with Fire Spells deals Chaos Damage instead of Fire Damage

entries.name: Ritual Cadence
entries.description_html: Invocation Skills instead Trigger Spells every 2 seconds. Invocation Skills cannot gain Energy while Triggering Spells. Invoked Spells consume 50% less Energy.
entries.description_plain: Invocation Skills instead Trigger Spells every 2 seconds. Invocation Skills cannot gain Energy while Triggering Spells. Invoked Spells consume 50% less Energy.

entries.name: Elemental Weakness
entries.description_html: Elemental Weakness is a Curse that lowers Elemental Resistances. If not otherwise specified, it lowers Elemental Resistances by 30% and has a duration of 20 seconds.
entries.description_plain: Elemental Weakness is a Curse that lowers Elemental Resistances. If not otherwise specified, it lowers Elemental Resistances by 30% and has a duration of 20 seconds.

entries.name: Fissure
entries.description_html: Certain Skills create Fissures that travel along the ground, dealing Damage over an Area.
entries.description_plain: Certain Skills create Fissures that travel along the ground, dealing Damage over an Area.

entries.name: Debilitate
entries.description_html: Debilitate is a Debuff that inflicts 20% reduced movement speed and 10% reduced damage dealt. Unless specified, Debilitate lasts 1 second.
entries.description_plain: Debilitate is a Debuff that inflicts 20% reduced movement speed and 10% reduced damage dealt. Unless specified, Debilitate lasts 1 second.

entries.name: Support Gem Categories
entries.description_html: Every Support Gem falls into one or more Categories. Support Gems from the same Category cannot be socketed into the same skill simultaneously, but can be used across multiple skills.
entries.description_plain: Every Support Gem falls into one or more Categories. Support Gems from the same Category cannot be socketed into the same skill simultaneously, but can be used across multiple skills.

entries.name: Minimum Modifier Level
entries.description_html: Added random modifiers are at least this level or higher, except if a specific modifier type would be excluded entirely from being able to roll. You cannot use this currency on items with item level below the minimum modifier level.
entries.description_plain: Added random modifiers are at least this level or higher, except if a specific modifier type would be excluded entirely from being able to roll. You cannot use this currency on items with item level below the minimum modifier level.

entries.name: Maximum Item Level
entries.description_html: You cannot use this currency on items above this level.
entries.description_plain: You cannot use this currency on items above this level.

entries.name: Heat
entries.description_html: Heat is gained from using specific Crossbow Skills, and can be either beneficial or detrimental depending on the Skill.
entries.description_plain: Heat is gained from using specific Crossbow Skills, and can be either beneficial or detrimental depending on the Skill.

entries.name: Elemental Infusions
entries.description_html:
Some Skills create Elemental Infusion Remnants when specific conditions are met. Picking up the Remnant grants you the Infusion for 20 seconds or until it is Consumed by another Skill. You can have up to 3 of each Infusion by default.

Skills that can Consume Infusions specifically mention the type(s) of Infusion they can Consume and the benefits for doing so. If a Skill repeats or reoccurs, each of them must Consume an Infusion separately to gain the effect.
entries.description_plain: Some Skills create Elemental Infusion Remnants when specific conditions are met. Picking up the Remnant grants you the Infusion for 20 seconds or until it is Consumed by another Skill. You can have up to 3 of each Infusion by default. Skills that can Consume Infusions specifically mention the type(s) of Infusion they can Consume and the benefits for doing so. If a Skill repeats or reoccurs, each of them must Consume an Infusion separately to gain the effect.

entries.name: Desecrated Modifiers
entries.description_html:
Desecrating an item adds an Unrevealed Desecrated modifier. If modifiers are full then a random modifier is also removed. These modifiers can be revealed at the Well of Souls.

Items with Desecrated Modifiers cannot be Desecrated again.
entries.description_plain: Desecrating an item adds an Unrevealed Desecrated modifier. If modifiers are full then a random modifier is also removed. These modifiers can be revealed at the Well of Souls. Items with Desecrated Modifiers cannot be Desecrated again.

entries.name: Marked for Death
entries.description_html: Marked for Death is a Debuff that causes you to take 50% increased damage.
entries.description_plain: Marked for Death is a Debuff that causes you to take 50% increased damage.

entries.name: Lineage Supports
entries.description_html:
Lineage Supports are powerful and transformative Support Gems which can drop in maps, or come from specific sources like a particular Boss.

You may only Socket one copy of any given Lineage Support across all of your Skills at once.
entries.description_plain: Lineage Supports are powerful and transformative Support Gems which can drop in maps, or come from specific sources like a particular Boss. You may only Socket one copy of any given Lineage Support across all of your Skills at once.

entries.name: Naturally Spawning Monsters
entries.description_html: Naturally Spawning Monsters are those who are spawned upon entering an area for the first time. Monsters that spawn from Secondary Mechanics like Strongboxes or Expedition do not count as Naturally Spawning.
entries.description_plain: Naturally Spawning Monsters are those who are spawned upon entering an area for the first time. Monsters that spawn from Secondary Mechanics like Strongboxes or Expedition do not count as Naturally Spawning.

entries.name: [DNT] Edict Declaration
entries.description_html: [DNT] You gain edict declaration when you disable a mod with The Towering Shadow
entries.description_plain: [DNT] You gain edict declaration when you disable a mod with The Towering Shadow

entries.name: Union of Souls
entries.description_html: Monsters in a Union of Souls transfer their soul to other Monsters when slain, granting the receiving Monster 20% Toughness, 5% increased damage and 10% increased Rarity of items dropped.
entries.description_plain: Monsters in a Union of Souls transfer their soul to other Monsters when slain, granting the receiving Monster 20% Toughness, 5% increased damage and 10% increased Rarity of items dropped.

entries.name: Union of Souls
entries.description_html: Monster Packs in a Union of Souls transfer their soul to other Monsters in their Pack when slain, granting the receiving Monsters 20% Toughness, and 5% increased damage.
entries.description_plain: Monster Packs in a Union of Souls transfer their soul to other Monsters in their Pack when slain, granting the receiving Monsters 20% Toughness, and 5% increased damage.

entries.name: Thaumaturgical Dynamism
entries.description_html:
While Thaumaturgical Dynamism is active, you passively generate a Power, Frenzy or Endurance Charge once every eight seconds.

The kind of Charge you generate is determined by the Attribute Requirements of the Skills you have socketed in your Skill Gem sockets. The higher the total Strength Requirement total of your socketed Skill Gems, the more likely you will be to generate an Endurance Charge. Higher total Dexterity Requirement corresponds to a higher chance for Frenzy Charges, and Intelligence to Power Charges.
entries.description_plain: While Thaumaturgical Dynamism is active, you passively generate a Power, Frenzy or Endurance Charge once every eight seconds. The kind of Charge you generate is determined by the Attribute Requirements of the Skills you have socketed in your Skill Gem sockets. The higher the total Strength Requirement total of your socketed Skill Gems, the more likely you will be to generate an Endurance Charge. Higher total Dexterity Requirement corresponds to a higher chance for Frenzy Charges, and Intelligence to Power Charges.

entries.name: Armour Movement Penalties
entries.description_html:
Depending on the type of Armour equipped, Players will have a less Movement Speed penalty applied depending on what Attribute the Armour requires. These penalties only apply to equipped Body Armours and Shields.
For Body Armour, pure Strength has a 5% penalty, hybrid Strength and Dexterity or Intelligence has a 4% penalty and pure Dexterity or Intelligence has a 3% penalty.
For Shields, pure Strength has a 3% penalty, hybrid Strength and Dexterity or Intelligence has a 1.5% penalty and pure Dexterity or Intelligence has no penalty.
entries.description_plain: Depending on the type of Armour equipped, Players will have a less Movement Speed penalty applied depending on what Attribute the Armour requires. These penalties only apply to equipped Body Armours and Shields. For Body Armour, pure Strength has a 5% penalty, hybrid Strength and Dexterity or Intelligence has a 4% penalty and pure Dexterity or Intelligence has a 3% penalty. For Shields, pure Strength has a 3% penalty, hybrid Strength and Dexterity or Intelligence has a 1.5% penalty and pure Dexterity or Intelligence has no penalty.

entries.name: Merging
entries.description_html: Merging Crossbow bolts have fragments that can hit the same target at the same time to combine their damage into a single Hit.
entries.description_plain: Merging Crossbow bolts have fragments that can hit the same target at the same time to combine their damage into a single Hit.

entries.name: Pacification
entries.description_html: Pacified Enemies cannot deal damage.
entries.description_plain: Pacified Enemies cannot deal damage.

entries.name: Archon Buff
entries.description_html:
Archons are a type of Buff that augment your Elemental prowess with Spells. There are Archon Buffs related to each Element: Flame Archon, Ice Archon, and Lightning Archon.

By default each Archon Buff lasts 10 seconds, but will be removed early if you use any non-instant Attack.

You cannot gain any Archon Buff while you already have one, or during a recovery period after you lose one, which lasts 20 seconds by default.
entries.description_plain: Archons are a type of Buff that augment your Elemental prowess with Spells. There are Archon Buffs related to each Element: Flame Archon, Ice Archon, and Lightning Archon. entries.description_html:
Ice Archon is a type of Archon Buff.
Ice Archon grants:
25% more Cold Damage with Spells
Convert 100% of Elemental Damage with Spells to Cold Damage
Cannot deal Non-Cold Damage with Spells
Hits with Spells cause 100% more Freeze Buildup

Cannot deal Non-Fire Damage with Spells
